I've clocked in many years working in tech both domestically in India and stateside in Corporate America. The biggest game changer? Co-founding a company and stepping in as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO). It's been one thrilling ride!

We've brought to life Inpharmd, a landmark project that stands as the most ambitious undertaking of my career thus far. This game-changing platform harnesses the power of AI to respond precisely to inquiries from healthcare professionals, providing them with thorough, evidence-backed responses and succinct summaries of pertinent literature. 

Having built this, we've taken a significant stride in healthcare information management, underlining our unwavering dedication to fostering innovation within the sector.

name: Ashli Templer
title: Founder & Director at Yours Only - skin and haircare for sensitive humans⚡️
about:
Hi, I'm Ashli, the founder of skin and haircare brand, Yours Only. 

After experiencing health issues my entire life I hung up my social media career shoes, and decided to take my career down a completely different path by combining the skills in my first degree with my allergies and love for beauty. Yours Only was born in 2020, after two very long years of development. I couldn’t find a product on the market which suited my needs, so I created a groundbreaking, allergy-friendly skincare brand called Yours Only. Not only is it dermatologically tested, but it’s suitable for babies, teens, tweens, Mumma’s and pregnant women. At the same time, I decided to build the brand to be inclusive by created my own podcast, Allergy Proof. This podcasts breaks the boundaries when it comes to talking about taboo topics, where we listen to stories of busy women who have been through their own health journey, specialists come in and help us understand certain topics, and I personally provide my experiences and tips. 

I am always open to collaborating, talking on your podcast or strategising on ways we can help people who have been secretly suffering from allergies and auto-immune conditions. Chat soon?

education_2_degree: Bachelor's Degree, Product Development and Merchandising
speaking_engagements: Guest on Glow Journal podcast discussing founder journey and sensitive skincare industry
notable_achievements: Founder of Yours Only by Glow Journal; Host of the Allergy Proof® podcast

name: Tamir Wolf
title: Working around the clock to make surgery better for everyone @ theator
about:
I'm a physician scientist, former Navy SEAL, turned health tech founder, determined to drag surgery into the data age. My journey began at the Technion, where I earned MD and PhD degrees exploring how physiology sparks innovation. Next came a different uniform: Lieutenant Commander and Head of Medicine for Israel’s SEALs. On missions, I learned the value of decisive action, earning the Medal of Distinguished Service after treating teammates while under fire.

That battlefield urgency never left me. I refined my business aim at Harvard Business School and in 2018 co-founded Theator, leading a phenomenal team that has built a platform that analyzes every surgical moment, applies AI to procedural footage, and transforms raw video into objective operative reports. We prove daily that transparency and clear metrics outperform intuition, one procedure at a time.

Our mission is simple and audacious: tackle variability in surgical care so that where you live does not determine if you live. Across startups, hospital corridors, and Harvard classrooms, I have seen the same truth: real progress demands that we shed comfort, question sacred rituals, and open the operating room to evidence.
experience_3_title: Sr. Director, Operations & Development, Clinical Trials Center
awards_and_recognitions: Medal of Distinguished Service for treatment of wounded under fire
speaking_engagements: Interview on The Matias Experiment podcast; Interview with Maxwell Cooper, M.D.; Interview on BackTable podcast
notable_achievements: Co-Founder and CEO of Theator, a company advancing surgical technology through artificial intelligence
reasoning: Tamir Wolf demonstrates strong operational and leadership experience through multiple high-responsibility roles, combining medical expertise (MD/PhD), military leadership (Navy SEAL Lieutenant Commander), and entrepreneurial experience. name: Jean Paoli
title: (Hiring ML/Math PhD/MS + Devs + Sales) Founder, CEO at Docugami Inc.
about:
I am the former President of Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc., and one of the co-creators of the XML 1.0 standard with the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). 

I recently left Microsoft to start my 7th startup for enterprise users in the domain of productivity, machine learning and semi-structured data and documents - starting with my deep believe that openness and interoperability raises all boats.

Throughout my entire career, I worked in startups: before Microsoft, with INRIA, the renown French research Labs in 2 of its startups (Gipsi S.A. and Grif S.A.); and within Microsoft creating 4 new startups: XML, InfoPath, opening the Office formats and MS OpenTech. I also recently worked on the Internet of Things.

I still remember the amazed eyes of our customers and to many in the industry when Microsoft led the way with XML, driving the industry to the web services era; when with InfoPath, we created a schematized way for capturing document information for our Office business users and when we opened the Office file formats by XML-izing and standardizing them, ushering a new era of document processing. 

We proudly created MS OpenTech, Microsoft's open source (!!) subsidiary, initiating, at scale, Microsoft Azure’s all-up support for open source and driving today's 40% of Azure usage.

I am the recipient of multiple industry awards for my work on XML, semi-structured data, the convergence of documents and data and openness at large. The startups I built created breakthrough platform technologies used today by millions. 

In addition to core technical design, I take deep care at building healthy ecosystems at worldwide scale. I am one of the key leaders responsible for shifting in a fundamental way, under the guidance of the CEO, Microsoft's strategy to embrace and love open source.

education_2_school: École nationale des ponts et chaussées

speaking_engagements: Co-creator of XML 1.0 standard with W3C; Key leader in shifting Microsoft’s open source strategy; Founder and CEO of Docugami, speaking on AI and document engineering
notable_achievements: Co-creator of XML 1.0 specification with W3C XML Working Group; Leader in Office Open XML (OOXML) development and standardization; Former President of Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc.; Recipient of multiple industry awards for work on XML and semi-structured data; Instrumental in opening Office file formats using XML; Founder and CEO of AI-driven Docugami focused on document engineering

name: Scott Cubbler
title: Retired Supply Chain executive, husband and father
about:
The Supply Chain Industry is currently experiencing an amazing time of growth and transformation. While public’s awareness of the industry has increased significantly, the challenges facing it have never been greater. Personally, I have always been fascinated by new technologies and their potential to increase efficiency, improve safety, and enhance people's lives. The rapid pace of technological advancements in Automation, Robotics, AI, and Machine Learning is truly transformational, and the only limits we face are our own ideas and our willingness to embrace change.

The adoption of new technologies in the Supply Chain Industry will have a dramatic and positive impact on all of us. Automation and Robotics, for instance, have the potential to reduce accidents and prevent injuries, eliminate repetitive and unnecessary tasks, and prevent mistakes while speeding up deliveries. AI and Machine Learning, on the other hand, will enable us to make better decisions, identify inefficiencies, and streamline operations, all of which will ultimately reduce costs.

However, change is never easy and often takes longer than anticipated. As leaders in the industry, we must not only be visionaries and competent individuals but also teachers and motivators with an unwavering passion for making our organizations more agile in adapting to future changes. It is imperative that we embrace change, stay ahead of the curve, and constantly explore new ways to leverage technology to enhance the supply chain for the betterment of everyone involved.
speaking_engagements: Strategic Advisor providing counsel to leadership on growth and innovation at Motion2AI

Graylan Wills
CEO, AI Insurance Services

About Me: I am a seasoned professional with a diverse background spanning both military service and the financial industry. Let me share my story:

Military Service:
I proudly served in the United States Air Force for 7 years. During this time, I honed my discipline, leadership skills, and commitment to excellence.

At AI Insurance Services, we believe in integrity, transparency, and client-centricity. Our commitment is to provide personalized guidance, ensuring peace of mind for every policyholder.
As a leader, I foster a culture of continuous learning, embracing change, and staying ahead of industry trends. Our team thrives on innovation and forward-thinking solutions.
Passion Beyond the Office:
When I’m not immersed in insurance matters, I am a husband and the proud father of four beautiful girls, and I cherish spending time with them.

about:
As an internal medicine physician and the founder of Health Note, I'm passionate about reshaping healthcare with thoughtfully designed technology that enhances, rather than replaces, the human connection between providers and patients.

At Health Note, we've pioneered an AI-driven platform that effortlessly guides patients from their very first interaction—be it a phone call, text, or digital intake—seamlessly into clinical workflows, reducing administrative burdens and empowering care teams to focus on meaningful patient engagement. Our mission is simple yet transformative: make healthcare interactions frictionless, insightful, and profoundly human.

Over the past seven years, I've had the privilege of leading an exceptional team of engineers, designers, and healthcare experts. Together, we've scaled Health Note to support millions of patient visits annually, integrating deeply with major EMR systems such as Epic, and continuously innovating to elevate the standard for digital health experiences.

I'm deeply committed to leveraging my clinical background and firsthand experience navigating healthcare inefficiencies to deliver practical solutions that clinicians trust and patients appreciate. Let's connect—I'm always eager to explore how technology can further enhance the human experience of healthcare.

name: Logan Farrell
title: Helping Construction Build Better
about:
I am the Co-Founder and CTO for Rugged Robotics, building and leading the engineering arm of the company to develop and deploy intelligent automation for commercial construction. 

I have 7 years of experience in robotic design and development at the NASA: Johnson Space Center. This experience includes 3 years of mechanical design and 4 years of software development. I led a team of 8 to develop robotic technologies necessary for robotic manipulation in spacecraft with limited communication. I have experience leading software development teams for dexterous robotics for robot perception, cognition, mobility and manipulation. I have mechanical design experience in actuator design for lunar rovers. 

My education includes a Bachelor's (University of Illinois) and Master's (Rice University) in Mechanical Engineering, both with a focus in robotics. My thesis, "The In-Use Efficiency of One- and Two-Stage Cycloidal Drivers" covers the efficiency of as-built cycloidal drives and develops new equations for determining expected efficiency of the drives, validated by the testing. My Master's coursework focused on robotic dynamics, path and motion planning, and deployment on UR5 robot systems. 

Outside of my career, I mentor high school students in the FIRST robotics program, to spread my passion for robotics and invention. Finally, I spend as much time outside as possible, between sand volleyball, running, hiking, and camping.

name: Christopher Condon
title: Founder, Chairman, CEO & Investor| Global Digital Ecosystem| Intelligent Interoperability | Ai & Quantum Transformation | Mini Mesh Ai Enhanced Data Centers | Smart Cities to future Technopolis |
about:
Mr. Condon is a former professional tennis player and financial advisor who currently focuses on social impact projects, public-private partnerships, and creating smart communities that benefit individuals and governments. He excels in identifying projects and opportunities, negotiating contracts, securing capital, and structuring strategic business alliances and exits. Born in Brooklyn, NY, in 1975 and raised on Long Island, Mr. Condon attended Nassau Community College, where he won the National gold medal college tennis championships for singles and the silver medal in doubles, before receiving a full tennis scholarship to Florida Atlantic University in Boca Raton, Florida, in 1996.

After working as a financial advisor and obtaining his securities and insurance licenses, Mr. Condon's first venture was with UCLA on environmental technologies, including plasma torch technology for waste remediation, non-linear ion propulsion engine for the telecommunications industry, cell phone frequency remediation, and ion separator technologies. He later established a company in the beverage industry and sold his brand in approximately 10,000 locations. In 2012, he founded Health Symmetric, the first healthcare technology company certified by Health & Human Services as a platform and with a perfect score on Hi Trust for security. Health Symmetric had a Master Service Agreement with United Healthcare.

In 2019, Mr. Condon founded iByond and currently serves as its CEO and Executive Chairman. iByond is one of the first groups of companies focused on economic performance, job creation, increasing a nation’s GDP, and creating knowledge economies of happiness. Countries are now measured in the “Happiness Quotient”. iByond leverages "best of class" fifth-generation technologies in healthcare, education, real estate, supply chain, smart cities, hospitality, automotive, and renewable energy. iByond is a Platform as a Service (iPaaS) with its Intelligent Interoperability Ecosystem Platform.

name: Ron Sege

about:
Ron Sege is a Partner at Benhamou Global Ventures (BGV). Ron has more than 37  years of operating experience with disruptive offerings in the Enterprise IT market, in established public companies and venture-backed startups. Ron has extensive cross-border management experience, managing operations in China, UK, Continental Europe and Israel. Ron specializes in go-to-market strategy and tactics, having started his career in Field Operations at ROLM Corporation and 3Com. 

He later moved into Division General Management  and President, CEO and Chairman roles in both public and private companies. He has deep insights into the telecom market (ROLM Corporation), Enterprise Networking and Cyber Security (3Com Corporation), Wireless Technologies (3Com and Tropos Networks) and Industrial IOT (Echelon Corporation). Ron has participated or led 4 sell-side M&A deals and more than 10 buy-side deals. 

He is currently on the Board of Ubiquiti Networks  (NASDAQ:UBNT) and the Advisory Board of McRock Capital Industrial IOT (IIoT) Venture Fund. Ron previously served on the public Boards of 3Com Corporation and Echelon Corporation and the private Boards of Ellacoya Networks and Tropos Networks. Ron has also been on the Boards of non-profit groups Silicon Valley Education Foundation, Silicon Valley Leadership Group and TheatreWorks Silicon Valley. Ron has 4 children and splits his time between Vail, Colorado where his daughter is a downhill ski racer, and Silicon Valley.

name: Kenneth Munson
title: Chief Executive Officer, Founder, Board Member, and Adjunct Lecturer
about:
As a recognized leader in grid-edge innovation, Ken Munson is the CEO of Harvest Thermal, a company redefining home heating with a breakthrough thermal storage platform that makes electrification cleaner, cheaper, and smarter. He also serves as the Founder of Rhythmos, which developed a digital platform that optimizes the EV- and DER-driven energy ecosystem—enabling stakeholders to transition to a decarbonized grid and accelerate the adoption of electric vehicles and distributed energy resources. The Rhythmos platform applies deep machine learning, AI, and power systems engineering to optimize grid performance and deliver granular distribution network awareness—removing barriers to electrification and improving utility visibility of behind-the-meter assets.

Prior to Rhythmos, Ken led the commercial scale and sale of Congruitive to Tantalus Systems (TSX: GRID), an advanced metering and smart grid technology company that transforms aging one-way grids into future-proofed multi-directional grids.

Prior, he was co-founder and CEO of Sunverge Energy where, under his leadership was awarded multiple patents, voted to the Global Cleantech 100 list for three consecutive years, and was named a Frost & Sullivan Asia Pacific Best Practice award winner; achieved top ranking in Navigant’s Leaderboard Reports for Virtual Power Plant Software and as a Distributed Scale Energy Storage Systems Integrator, and named to Greentech Media’s Grid Edge 20 as a disruptive leader to be watched in the field of technology and energy. 

Ken serves on the Board of Directors for Box Power, providing clean, reliable, and affordable energy to rural customers. He is also a mentor for emerging technology companies focused on energy and renewables through Launch Alaska and Early Stage Montana.  Ken has also served as Adjunct Lecturer in Entrepreneurial Finance and Managing Technology Innovation at St. Mary’s College of California Graduate School of Economics and Business Administration. 

Ken graduated from California State University at Sacramento with a bachelor's degree in Communications and earned his MBA from St. Mary’s College of California Graduate School of Economics and Business Administration and current resides in Northwestern Montana.

about:
I build the systems that help dealerships thrive in a digital-first, AI-powered world. As CEO of BLiNK AI, I’m leading the charge to reinvent how dealers engage customers—turning every service lane, phone call, and telematics alert into a revenue-driving, loyalty-building moment.

Our latest breakthrough: Telematica™, the first platform built for the last mile of automotive telematics. While the industry has focused on generating data, we’re focused on delivering outcomes—activating alerts, booking service, and driving real vehicles into real bays.

We’re not just another software vendor. We’re the Operating System of Customer Engagement for automotive retail—automating scheduling, boosting RO values, optimizing shop capacity, and helping service departments finally tap into the full potential of connected cars.

My focus:
🚀 Scaling SaaS from $5M to $100M+
🔁 Building repeatable R&D + GTM engines that actually work
🧠 Turning AI + telematics into real KPIs—appointments, service revenue, retention, CSI
🛠️ Helping Fixed Ops leaders drive profit, not paperwork
🤝 Partnering with OEMs, dealer groups, and innovators shaping the future

Also: startup mentor, offsite architect, and scoutmaster for a special needs BSA troop—because leadership isn’t just a job, it’s a calling.

Let’s connect if you’re building, transforming, or rethinking what’s possible in auto retail—or if you’re wondering why telematics has never quite lived up to the hype (until now).

As the co-founder and CEO, I oversee the vision, strategy, and execution of the company, as well as the technical and product development.

I have a strong background in applied artificial intelligence research, and extensive experience in applying AI and NLP techniques to various domains, such as life sciences, finance, media, and education. This has enabled unprecedented access and insights for subject matter experts, fueling data-driven decisions and actions.

My technical acumen in Generative AI, including GPT-3 and GPT-4, underpins our platform's capabilities, ensuring that efficiency and adaptability remain our hallmarks. Our mission is to empower organizations with AI-driven knowledge automation, paving the way for a more efficient and insightful future in life sciences.

name: Dan Vahdat
title: CEO, Founder and member of #Huma(ns)
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Dan Vahdat is the founder and CEO of Huma Therapeutics, a global healthcare AI company on a mission to accelerate the adoption of digital solutions in care and research.

Huma’s technology has powered over 4,500 hospitals and clinics. The platform has been used to engage and screen & triage over 50 million individuals, with millions of active users across its various products in 70+ countries. The company is renowned for its role in major national healthcare projects worldwide, from the US and the UK to Germany, Greece, and Saudi Arabia, as well as collaborating with most large pharma companies.

Dan started his journey as a PhD student at Johns Hopkins and has since raised over $200 million in funding, driving Huma to its leading position today.

He is widely recognised as a trailblazer, innovator, and entrepreneur: HealthTech Leader of the Year 2023, twice named one of FT Europe’s fastest-growing companies (2021 & 2023), two-time winner of the Prix Galien, and more. Dan is also a member of the World Economic Forum, part of the Global Innovators & Tech Pioneers, as well as the Unicorn Community.

name: Marc Zao-Sanders
title: filtered.com co-Founder; author of Timeboxing - The Power of Doing One Thing at a Time
about:
*About me*

Passionate about the intersection of numbers, language, and AI, I explore how these elements drive innovation in the learning tech industry. As the CEO of Filtered.com, I'm deeply involved in shaping the future of educational technology, focusing on personalized learning experiences powered by intelligent algorithms.

My interest extends to concepts of agency, intentionality, and efficient time management, as demonstrated in my book "Timeboxing - The Power of Doing One Thing at a Time," published by Penguin Random House and now reaching a global audience in 33 languages.

*How I can help*

Insights from 'Timeboxing': Dive into the principles of focused productivity through my book. It's not just about doing things; it's about doing the right things at the right time.

Newsletter: Join my community through the "One Thing at a Time" newsletter. Every Wednesday, I share actionable insights on harnessing the power of focused action. Sign up at marczaosanders.com/newsletter.

AI talks: Hear firsthand about the practical applications of AI in today's world. I'll be keynoting for Harvard Business Review in Sao Paolo and bring real-world examples of AI transforming industries and enhancing personal productivity. Talks to demystify AI in very real terms.

Let's connect and explore how we can harness technology and intentional living to create impactful learning experiences and lead more productive lives.

name: Marius George Linguraru
title: Scientist, Professor and Entrepreneur | AI for Pediatric Health and Rare Diseases
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
Marius George Linguraru, DPhil, MA, MSc loves to work with multidisciplinary teams of clinicians, scientists, and engineers to advance global health and improve the lives of vulnerable children and patients with rare diseases through AI-driven solutions. He is the Connor Family Professor and Endowed Chair in Research and Innovation at Children’s National Hospital in Washington, D.C., where he leads the AI research initiatives. He also holds faculty appointments as Professor of Radiology and Pediatrics at The George Washington University.

Dr. Linguraru co-founded PediaMetrix Inc., a company focused on improving pediatric health through AI. He joined Children’s National from the National Institutes of Health, earned his doctorate from the University of Oxford, and completed fellowships at the French National Institute for Research in Digital Science and Technology (INRIA) and Harvard University.

Dr. Linguraru has received numerous honors for his contributions to science and medicine, including the Excellence in Engineering Award at the UK Houses of Parliament and the Distinguished Service Award from the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBS). His AI-based, mobile, non-invasive screening tool for genetic conditions was a finalist in STAT Madness 2018, the national competition for top innovations in science and medicine organized by STAT News. His work has been featured in The Economist, The Washington Post, The Times (London), and the Associated Press.

Dr. Linguraru has served in leadership roles across prominent scientific societies, including IEEE EMBS, the IEEE Signal Processing Society, and the Society of Medical Information Processing and Analysis (SIPAIM). He is the President of the @Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention (MICCAI) Society.

Specialties: Research and Innovation Management, Consortium Management, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Digital Health, Translational Science, Global Health, Rare Diseases, Quantitative Imaging, Radiomics, BiomarkersImaging, Pediatric Imaging, Clinical Trials

Michael Zung is a seasoned entrepreneur and executive with extensive experience at the intersection of technology, eCommerce, and marketing. He co-founded Bloomist, a sustainable direct-to-consumer home decor brand renowned for its innovative EcoFaux™ botanicals, and successfully sold the company in 2024 to leading wellness brand Zogics. Michael will continue as a consultant for Bloomist through 2025, supporting its growth and strategic initiatives.

Over his career, Michael has been instrumental in launching and scaling transformative businesses globally. He played a pivotal role in expanding DoubleClick (now Google) and HSBC’s direct banking operations in Asia, helping to establish market leadership in their respective industries. At Bazaarvoice, he led the brand’s Asia Pacific operations, building high-performing teams and forging partnerships with major clients such as Epson, P&G, and Samsung. Earlier in his career, Michael founded the digital agency OneXeno, which served global clients including eBay, Marriott, Coach, and Toys R Us before its acquisition by publicly listed Next15.

In addition to building businesses, Michael is passionate about fostering innovation and sharing his expertise. He serves as a mentor with his alma mater William & Mary and the Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator, regularly speaking at industry events on topics such as eCommerce trends, social commerce, and sustainability.

Currently, Michael works with brands and technology partners, leveraging his leadership, entrepreneurial mindset, and growth-focused approach to deliver impactful results. With a unique blend of strategic insight and hands-on experience, he continues to drive success across the eCommerce and advertising technology ecosystems.

name: Rachel Kuperman
title: CEO @ Eysz | Transforming Diagnosis and Management of Neurological Disorders
about:
As the CEO of Eysz, I am leading the development of a digital health platform that uses passive eye-movements as input to measure, diagnose, and predict neurological disease, starting with epilepsy.

My passion for improving neurological outcomes stems from my previous role as the Medical Director of the epilepsy program at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital Oakland, where I worked for 10 years. There, I focused on excellence in clinical care and research, and realized the need for better tools to accurately measure the burdens of epilepsy: seizures, side effects, and cognitive effects. Eysz comes out of my clinical work to help parents, caregivers, and physicians quantitate these outcomes and personalize treatment plans. I am also a board-certified neurologist and epileptologist.

about:
Dr. Lal is CEO and Co-Founder of GEn1E Lifesciences Inc (www.gen1e.com). GEn1E is a clinical-stage biotech company accelerating novel, next-generation immunomodulatory therapies for Rare & Inflammatory diseases.

She has over 20 years of experience in Biotech/Pharma companies.  Her passion is to bring healthcare products to patients in a cost-effective and efficient manner. In her role as a Senior Executive, she led Preclinical and Clinical Development teams. She has taken compounds from Discovery to Regulatory Approval and has filed more than 15 Investigational New Drug Applications (IND) in disease areas of neurology, inflammation, virology, pain, and oncology. Two compounds have received New Drug Application (NDA) approvals from the US FDA and Ministry of Health and Welfare, Japan (Kaletra for the treatment of HIV and Horizant (Regnite in Japan) for Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS) and Post Herpetic Neuralgia (PHN)).

Dr. Lal has a doctorate in Pharmaceutical Sciences and Pharmacology from the University of Maryland and a Master's degree in Pharmacology from the University of Arizona. Dr. Lal has over 60 publications, book chapters, and presentations. She received a Master’s in Management from Stanford University’s MSx (Sloan) Program.

name: Ouwen Huang
title: Founder @ Gradient | Executive in Residence @ Duke Statistics | Duke MD, PhD Trainee
about: Ouwen Huang completed a B.S. in Computer Science at Duke University in 2016. He remained at Duke University to immediately begin his M.D., Ph.D. training program. During his undergraduate studies, he was an inventor of a precision health prediction tool that received NSF STTR grant 1721737. In 2014, he founded a satellite imaging company, FarmShots, which was funded by YCombinator. From 2017-2018, he took leave from his graduate training program to continue his entrepreneurial aspirations. During this time, FarmShots was acquired by Syngenta in February 2018 for $5.5M, and he briefly stayed to serve as a Senior Research Scientist. He shortly left to found a medical imaging AI company, Gradient Health, which has raised over $5M in venture funding to date. The company has received NCI Contract 75N91023C00021 to develop medical AI tooling. During his graduate studies, he received the Stephen Smith Fellowship and the NIH Kirschstein National Research Service Award. He is the author of 5 publications, presented at 3 conferences, and was an invited speaker to radiology conferences in Hangzhou and Singapore. He serves as a lead medical imaging consultant to RapidAI, and holds a provisional patent in reversible medical image de-identification. He has two birds that fly free in his home.

name: Mohsen Omrani
title: Co-Founder & CEO at OPTT, Assistant Professor of Psychiatry
about:
I am a researcher, entrepreneur, professor, husband and father. I have a passion for solving problems, continuous education, and challenging the status quo. My most recent research stems from my interest in the brain, how it works, how it fails to, and how we can fix it.

In 2006, I graduated as a medical doctor from Tehran University of Medical Sciences. Immediately following I completed a Master’s and PhD in Neuroscience at Queens University. Then, I completed a post-doctoral fellowship in computational psychiatry and neuromodulation at Rutgers University. Through my graduate and post-graduate studies, I was honoured to have been awarded multiple prestigious scholarships and fellowships by the Canadian government.

I am passionate about technology and its use to make life better for all others. My goal is to utilize my expertise in medicine, neurology, and technology to design tools for improving mental health.

The growing demand for quality mental health care isn’t going anywhere. At OPTT, I lead a team of exceptional people to build digital mental health solutions for the population. Our team is working hard to change the way mental health care is delivered. With the use of AI technology, OPTT provides health care professionals with insights for effective care pathways.

I am always looking to connect with other academics, CEO’s, and aspiring entrepreneurs. If this is you, let’s connect!
awards_and_recognitions: Shortlisted for the Centre for Aging Brain Health’s MC2 Program
speaking_engagements: Startup Grind discussion on growing a digital health company; Talk on using AI in mental health and cognitive behavioural therapy
notable_achievements: Developed AI applications for cognitive behavioural therapy; PhD in neuroscience and postdoctoral fellowship in computational neuropsychiatry

name: Nazanin Alavi
title: Co- Program Medical Director Mental Health & Addiction Care, Kingston Health Sciences Centre, Division Chair, Acute Adult Psychiatry, Queen's University
about:
For the past two decades, my research has focused on developing innovative solutions to enhance accessibility and effectiveness in mental health care. My journey began in 2007 when I immigrated to Canada and joined the Mood Research Lab at Queen’s University. Witnessing the challenges immigrants faced in accessing mental health care inspired me to pioneer online psychotherapy solutions tailored to diverse populations. This journey reached a significant milestone with the creation of OPTT (Online Psychotherapy Tool), a secure platform integrating data-driven practices and AI algorithms, recognized globally for its impact on mental health care delivery.

Joining the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) and later Queen’s University, I established an academic online psychotherapy lab, supervising a diverse team of trainees. I'm deeply invested in shaping the future of mental health education, facilitating workshops, teaching courses, and spearheading initiatives to optimize clinical training.

My clinical work centres on emergency psychiatry and ambulatory general psychiatry, where I've championed initiatives to improve access and quality of care. I remain an active clinician while fulfilling administrative roles as Program Medical Director and division chair at Queen’s University. My leadership philosophy revolves around fostering positive change and resilience in the face of challenges.

name: Kim Kelley
title: Expert workforce strategist leveraging data and AI to help government, business, education and community organizations develop, hire and build the future workforce today.
about:
As the CEO and Co-Founder of pepelwerk, I work to make it easier for government, business, education, member organizations and philanthropic foundations to work together to help people get, prepare and develop themselves for in-demand skills-based jobs. 

At pepelwerk, we are driven by a singular mission: to modernize our approach to careers and employment to produce a thriving economy. Our approach is rooted in the belief that a community driven AI tool with shared data can produce better results than any stand alone or siloed recruiting or talent management system. 

We start with an organizations strategic plan and vision and start to define a skills-based work plan. Once we have created your work plan, we start to build, develop and hire a workforce. The service and system will:

Create equitable opportunities to skills based jobs
Build a succession plan for people to expand their careers vertically and horizontally 
Reduce redundancy and waste in the education, hiring and citizen management functions required to keep people employed
Create a funnel of right time, right skill, right attributes to assign to work
Help organizations close the skills gap in real time and address skills shortages, particularly for skill-based roles, to drive revenue growth and competitive advantage.
Make it possible for more organizations to update how they offer professional development by offering individuals a personal AI Career Guide. 
Improve financial health of organizations and people

speaking_engagements: Guest on Call For Culture podcast discussing Impact Hiring; Speaker on Strategic Shift YouTube episode about education and workforce

name: Chuck Gershman
title: President and CEO, co-founder @ Owl Autonomous Imaging | Thermal Night Vision Solutions
about:
As a seasoned technology executive, entrepreneur, and innovator, I have dedicated my career to pioneering advancements in AI, semiconductor technology, and autonomous imaging. With over 30 years of leadership in executive management, engineering, business development, and venture funding, I have been at the forefront of driving transformative technologies from concept to commercialization.

Currently, I serve as the CEO & Co-founder of Owl Autonomous Imaging (Owl AI), where we are revolutionizing AI-driven high definition thermal imaging for security and safety through smarter autonomous systems. My passion for cutting-edge technology and business strategy has led to multiple successful startup ventures, including exits to Intel and PMC-Sierra (Microchip), and the raising of over $200M in capital.

Throughout my career, I have worked across industries, from high-tech startups to Fortune 500 companies, leading teams globally and delivering over $500M in technology sales. My expertise extends into government and defense, where I have played a critical role in advancing microprocessor technologies for NASA, the Department of Defense, and the intelligence community.

Honors such as my induction into Drexel University’s Alumni Circle of Distinction, being named a Top 40 Healthcare Transformer, and recognition as a finalist for EE Times’ High Tech Executive of the Year underscore my commitment to pushing the boundaries of innovation.

name: Kevin Meyer

about:
With over a decade of experience as an SRE and DevOps engineer, Kevin R Meyer is a seasoned professional renowned for steering technology transformations at both startups and Fortune 500 companies. Most recently excelling as the Team Lead for Developer Tooling at MarketAxess, Kevin has a proven track record of elevating team efficiency, enhancing infrastructure, and optimizing deployment processes.
 
At Palolo, he served as the Founding Staff Platform SRE, spearheading the company's infrastructure from inception to a successful product launch. Notably, he implemented a zero-trust multi-account multi-environment infrastructure, reducing deployment times by 75% and onboarding times by 80% while enabling both extremely fast development processes and a well-protected production environment.
 
In his most recent role at MarketAxess, Kevin has played a pivotal role in increasing the Developer Tooling Team's size by staffing up to 5 Engineers as well as improving developer velocity by among other things, optimizing internal VPN speed, showcasing his ability to scale and enhance technical capabilities. His achievements include standardizing on GitHub, migrating applications to Terraform, and deploying on-prem installations of existing services into AWS cloud infrastructure with Helm charts on Kubernetes.
 
As a Containerization and Orchestration Instructor at Interview Kickstart, Kevin has mentored hundreds of students and designed innovative interview scenarios. His commitment to education extends to creating reusable EKS clusters and facilitating live testing environments for cost-effective learning experiences.
 
Recognized with Feats of Engineering Awards at Google Cloud Logging and for the MongoDB Atlas Migration at Compass, Kevin's expertise has garnered awards for his outstanding contributions.
 
Kevin holds a B.S. in Engineering, Computer Science from the University of Michigan, underpinning his practical experience with a solid academic foundation.
 
Kevin's proficiency spans cloud platforms, programming languages, containerization, automation, databases, CI/CD, observability, and operating systems. His toolkit includes AWS, GCP, Python, Java, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, Datadog, and more.
 
Connect with Kevin to leverage his extensive expertise in optimizing technology stacks, enhancing team performance, and driving innovation in the dynamic field of DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering.

name: Jack Gilbert
title: Professor & Associate Vice Chancellor at UC San Diego and Pilot
about:
Professor Jack A Gilbert earned his Ph.D. from Unilever and Nottingham University, UK in 2002, and received his postdoctoral training at Queens University, Canada. From 2005-2010 he was a senior scientist at Plymouth Marine Laboratory, UK; and from 2010-2018 he was Group Leader for Microbial Ecology at Argonne National Laboratory, a Professor of Surgery, and Director of The Microbiome Center at University of Chicago. In 2019 he moved to University of California San Diego, where he is a Professor in Pediatrics and the Scripps Institution of Oceanography, Associate Vice Chancellor for Marine Science, and Director of the Microbiome and Metagenomics Center. Dr. Gilbert uses molecular analysis to test fundamental hypotheses in microbial ecology. 

He cofounded the Earth Microbiome Project and American Gut Project. He has authored more than 450 peer reviewed publications and book chapters on microbial ecology. He is the founding Editor in Chief of mSystems journal. In 2014 he was recognized on Crain’s Business Chicago’s 40 Under 40 List, and in 2015 he was listed as one of the 50 most influential scientists by Business Insider, and in the Brilliant Ten by Popular Scientist. In 2016 he won the Altemeier Prize from the Surgical Infection Society, and the WH Pierce Prize from the Society for Applied Microbiology for research excellence. In 2017 he co-authored “Dirt is Good”, a popular science guide to the microbiome and children’s health. In 2018, he founded BiomeSense Inc to produce automated microbiome sensors. In 2021 Dr Gilbert became the UCSD PI and Consortium Chair for the National institutes of Health’s $175M Nutrition for Precision Medicine program. In 2023 he became President of Applied Microbiology International and won the 2023 IFF Microbiome Science Prize. He is also a Private Pilot and plays in a punk rock band.
awards_and_recognitions: 2023 IFF Microbiome Science Prize
speaking_engagements: President of Applied Microbiology International (2023); UCSD PI for NIH's $175M Nutrition for Precision Medicine program; Founding Editor in Chief of mSystems journal; Co-founder of Earth Microbiome Project and American Gut Project; Author of over 450 peer-reviewed publications and book chapters; Co-author of the book 'Dirt is Good'
notable_achievements: Co-founded Quicken Loans, the largest mortgage lender in the US; Major investor in Detroit revitalization including restoration of historic buildings; Owner and operator of Rocket Arena in Cleveland, Ohio

His profile shows significant scientific innovation, industry recognition, and entrepreneurial activity. His role in creating major research initiatives (Earth Microbiome Project, American Gut Project) and securing substantial funding ($175M NIH program) demonstrates market-creating capabilities.

name: Kevin Honaker
title: CEO at BiomeSense, Inc
about:
I am the CEO and co-founder of BiomeSense, Inc., a seed stage start-up developing a novel biosensor platform for fully automated, low-cost, longitudinal microbiome data collection.  

I am currently solely responsible for strategic and operational leadership in the company, and run the day-to-day activities as we seek to scale. I am also responsible for all fundraising activities for the company. 

Prior to joining BiomeSense, I worked as a Technology Venture Fellow for the University of Chicago Polsky Center, tasked with enhancing the university’s technology commercialization efforts by serving as business lead for new discoveries, from the earliest stages of discovery.

Previously, I worked for a seed-stage start-up called PrescriptIQ, a company offering a unique software platform that helped physicians utilize pharmacogenomic information at the point of care. While there, I was one of two full-time employees, responsible for operations, product development, finance, and creation of investor-related materials. 

Before attending Booth, I worked as a consultant at HealthScape Advisors, a management consulting firm focusing on the health insurance industry. I worked both individually and with teams to help solve client issues by providing strategic, operational, and analytic support depending on the situation- this has included day-to-day on-site operational support, large data analysis, strategic / market entry assessments, and more.

I really enjoyed working as a consultant - the ability to have different experiences and use different skills depending on the specific project kept me constantly engaged. I also enjoyed traveling and being able to meet and work with many different people in person.

Before joining HealthScape I was a student at the University of Illinois where I graduated with degrees in Accounting and Finance.

name: Slim Souissi
title:
Co-founder and CEO at Ospitek Inc. 
Founder and CEO at Miotiv, Inc.
about:
Dr. Slim Souissi is the co-founder and CEO of OSPITEK, a leading HealthTech company that develops digital AI-IoT software for improving patient experience and surgical center productivity. He is also the founder and CEO of MIOTIV, a developer of IoT  platforms specializing in the development of bespoke SAAS platforms for the automotive and the healthcare industries .  He is the former president and COO of Novatel Wireless. He began his career at Motorola in '94 and made key contributions to the architecture FLEX paging data networks. In 1997, he lead the architecture of the company’s location based services platform. In 2000, Dr. Souissi joined Novatel Wireless to lead the Software Defined Radio program. He was promoted to CTO and VP of engineering in 2002. Dr. Souissi guided Novatel Wireless through the worldwide expansion of the mobile broadband market which culminated at a company valuation of more than $800M and an annual revenue of ~ $500M. Dr. Souissi and his team invented the award winning MiFi mobile hotspot creating a global market category worth tens of billions of dollars. Dr. Souissi is the holder of several MiFi essential patents asserted against ZTE and Apple. 

MiFi was picked by Time Magazine as one of the greatest/most influential gadgets of the century. The company was named by Forbes as one of the top five most innovative technology companies in America. Dr. Souissi was awarded the distinction of being part of ExecRank’s “Top CTO Rankings” of America in 2013 and 2014.

Dr. Souissi holds a MSEE degree from Ecole Central de Marseille, a MS degree in DSP from Supelec, France, a MSEE and a Ph.D from Georgia Tech. He was inducted into the Academy of Distinguished Engineering Alumni of Georgia Tech. Dr. Souissi is a published IEEE author and holds 60 US patents. He is the recipient of the distinguished innovator award from Motorola and the J.D. innovation award from Novatel. He served on the advisory boards of Nextivity, TAM and Zyray Wireless.
education_2_degree: MS in DSP, Digital Signal Processing
awards_and_recognitions: ExecRank’s Top CTO Rankings of America (2013, 2014); J.D. Innovation Award from Novatel Wireless
speaking_engagements: Industry thought leadership as CTO of Novatel Wireless pioneering wireless data technology; Founder and CEO roles with public recognition in HealthTech and IoT sectors
notable_achievements: Invented the award-winning MiFi mobile hotspot; Holder of several MiFi essential patents; MiFi recognized by Time Magazine as one of the greatest/most influential gadgets of the century; Novatel Wireless named by Forbes as one of the top five most innovative technology companies in America; Ranked in ExecRank’s Top CTO Rankings of America in 2013 and 2014; Received J.D. innovation award from Novatel Wireless
reasoning: Dr. Souissi demonstrates strong evidence of being a Market Innovator and Thought Leader based on multiple key factors: 1) He invented the MiFi mobile hotspot which created an entirely new market category worth billions, 2) He holds 60 US patents showing significant technical innovation, 3) He scaled Novatel Wireless to $800M valuation and $500M annual revenue as CTO/COO, 4) He received multiple prestigious industry awards and recognition, including ExecRank's Top CTO Rankings, 5) His innovations were recognized by Time Magazine and Forbes, placing him firmly in the thought leadership category. name: Andy Powell
title: VP of Customer Success at Virtual Facility
about:
Experienced B2B SaaS executive with a passion for driving customer success and a demonstrated history of addressing company-wide challenges.

I've taken two companies from $1M ARR to over $20M ARR. Some of my bigger accomplishments include: 

* Creating renewal experiences that drive retention by including reasonable price increases based on market conditions, minimizing customer and company investment to complete the renewal, and addressing unique customer challenges.

* Collaborating with the product team to define "North Stars" for product usage that rally the company around leading indicators of retention. These efforts improved retention forecasting and positively influenced the focus of product investment and customer experience initiatives. 

* Leveraging customer journey maps to align Implementation Services and Customer Success on key customer milestones that allow customers to realize value in our solutions. Better alignment had the following outcomes: higher accountability among team members, redefinition of implementation services packages for sales, and more consistent customer messaging through out the journey.
notable_achievements: Co-founder and CEO of CallRail, a marketing analytics company serving over 150,000 businesses; Co-founder and CEO of Learn to Win, a learning technology company serving professional sports teams, the US Department of Defense, and Fortune 500 companies; Part of the founding team of the African Leadership University, launching three new universities in Mauritius, Rwanda, and Kenya; Named to Forbes 30 under 30; Designed a course on Technology, Innovation and Modern Warfare at Stanford Graduate School of Business
reasoning: Andy Powell demonstrates proven operational experience scaling B2B SaaS companies with concrete metrics and achievements. His track record of scaling two companies from $1M to $20M ARR shows strong execution ability at the growth stage. name: Naman Maheshwari
title: Sr. Al/ML Engineer | Generative AI, AI/ML, Machine Learning | IISc, Bangalore
about:
I am a Senior Data Scientist at Global Foundries with an academic foundation and practical expertise in AI/ML. I completed my Master's degree from the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) Bangalore. I honed my skills in advanced AI methodologies and developed a deep understanding of cutting-edge machine-learning techniques.

With a passion for pushing the boundaries of AI, I work on complex projects that involve building intelligent solutions and driving data-driven insights. My experience spans a variety of domains, with a focus on leveraging deep learning and reinforcement learning to create predictive models and decision-making systems. At Global Foundries, I am part of a forward-thinking team, contributing to projects that shape the future of technology and data science.

name: M.A.Maluk Mohamed
title: Co-Founder, Global Vice President (Research) & Head - Twin India, Twin Health Inc
about:
Co founder and Global Vice President (Research) - Twin Health Inc., San Francisco, also Heads the India business taking care of operations for strategy, marketing, regulatory, public policy, go-to-market, for the company and plays a critical role during the launch of Twin Health in India. 
Obtained Ph.D. degree from IIT Madras, Chennai in 2006. M.E (CSE) from REC Tiruchirappalli in 1995. B.E.(ECE) from Bharathidasan University in 1993. Chairman of 3 higher education institutions - M.A.M. College of Engineering & Technology, M.A.M. School of Architecture and M.A.M. School of Business. 

In the current role with Twin Health through research on healthcare technology and insight driven decision making skills, formulates strategy towards strengthening the business footprint across the globe. Currently, mitochondrial disorders pose a significant challenge, with no highly effective treatment or cure available. Traditional management relies on supportive therapy, including nutritional management, exercise, and supplements.
At Twin Health, we've pioneered a revolutionary technology - the Whole Body Digital Twin (WBDT). This groundbreaking innovation enables precision treatment recommendations for nutrition, activities, and sleep, allowing us to address disrupted metabolism by fixing the mitochondria.
As a result, chronic metabolic diseases like diabetes, obesity, hypertension, fatty liver, and more are no longer inevitable lifelong conditions. With the WBDT, remission and smart management of these diseases have become a reality, enabling individuals to reduce or eliminate medications and substantially improve their quality of life, free from the fear of complications like heart attacks, strokes, and cancer.
 
Prior to co-founding Twin Health, played an active role in transforming the higher education space in Tamil Nadu, India. Was the President and Chairman of the MAM Group of Institutions in India. During my leadership, the group diversified its curriculum and started offering courses across genres like – Engineering, Architecture, Business Administration and Nursing across 10 colleges. 

An alumnus of IIT Madras, completed Doctorate of Philosophy in the area of distributed mobile computing, has published 237 research publications in various international journals and conference proceedings. Also holds a Master of Engineering degree from National Institute of Technology and a Bachelor of Engineering from Bharathidasan University. Guided 13 PhD research scholars. Has 2 patents in the area of health tech to his credit.

- Key technologies: Java (Spring Boot, Scala, Hibernate, Eureka), Golang, Python, Nginx, ElasticSearch, SQL/NoSQL databases (Oracle, Redis Cluster), Message Queues (RabbitMQ, Kafka, Kestrel), Hadoop (Hive, Spark), Web UI (Javascript), Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform

name: Anna Kroncke
title: Licensed Psychologist CO, GA and PSYPACT
about:
Companies are like families. 

📍Employees, like kids, need to feel calm and safe to do their best work. When employees have a sense that they are in a supportive community, they do the best work of their lives. 
⚡️ Yet, over half of employees with young kids are considering cutting back on their hours or quitting their jobs. 
👧🏼 Why? What is the most important thing in the life of a parent? 
It's their kids. 
And what about kids that are REALLY struggling? What if the kids have serious emotional or behavior problems? 

Maybe their kids have:
Anxiety
ADHD
Mood swings
Autism
Addiction or 
Anger issues

For years I have heard the same refrain from parents, "where were you 5 years ago?" "I have been looking for help for my child since they were little and I never knew where to turn or how to help." 

We use technology to bring mental health of working parents and caregivers and their children to the forefront. We know that parents who feel ready to take the lead in supporting their child's mental and behavioral health have more success. Their families lead happier lives. At Cadey we don't want location, financial resources or wait times to be a barrier to parents getting the support they need.

I am a child psychologist, and author of a leading autism assessment textbook. My experience spans over two decades as a school psychologist in an urban district, over a decade in clinical practice, and I have been working in the technology start up space for 5 years. As a psychologist in technology my partner and I developed the Cadey app for parents. 

The Cadey app helps working parents, immediately, for free, when they need it. As part of their employer benefits program Cadey is right there, easy to download and login with all kinds of resources at the ready. Video microlearning, courses, assessments, articles, blogs and webinars, Cadey has resources parents need. 

Cadey puts helpful advice and practical strategies for what to say and do at your fingertips, helping parents find and navigate a path to household peace and improved family relationships. 

In addition to being a tech entrepreneur, I have extensive experience conducting comprehensive psychological evaluations, assessment services, training doctoral students, and consulting with families, community providers and schools. I am passionate about educating parents on childhood mental health and providing supports and services. I believe that we can use technology to get information out there to families when they need it most.

name: Mona Patel
title:
Entrepreneur | CEO | Forbes Next 1000 | 
HBS | Stanford | MIT
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Conforming to preconceived notions leaves no room for becoming our highest selves. We become our highest or “haute”—selves living not by the standards of others, but by the high standards and values we create for ourselves. I call it the Haute Mindset.

My own haute mindset has helped me achieve things I’m immensely proud of.

Since moving to the U.S., I’ve founded multiple companies in real estate, healthcare and tech. Often called a Renaissance Woman, I possess both breadth and depth of knowledge and the unique ability to integrate multiple industries to create successful business strategies.

This approach has served me well and led to exponential business growth. But I’m not all tenacity and drive; my spiritual upbringing stressed the qualities of humility, empathy, compassion, and kindness.
 
A few years ago, despite my tremendous material success, I still felt unfulfilled. I was looking for purpose and found it after a soul-searching conversation with my mother, who helped me  realize I needed to be more grounded to my values and what mattered most: giving back and creating a legacy of positive impact. I started a nonprofit that leverages fashion to drive positive change through girls' education by supporting organizations leading projects in India. 

Today, I’m an advocate for gender equality and an investor in girls’ education because I understand first-hand how to transform your life into a position of strength.

I'm on a mission to inspire and guide women of color founders and serve as a reminder that they can be whatever they want to be!


REACH OUT:  
If you’re an industry leader who, like me, is determined to drive positive change, uphold “haute” standards for gender equality, and provide opportunities for women of color, we should connect.
Please visit www.hautemona.com

title: Driving long-term partnerships through AI solutions. + 21 years of global experience. Leading teams capable of operating with enterprise-level efficiency, driving digital transformation. Founder & CEO, DXwand.
about:
Today’s evolving global markets face a myriad of challenges, such as compliance hurdles and rising customer expectations. With nearly 20 years of experience leading digital transformations across the globe, I understand these challenges intimately.

𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬 & 𝐀𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
At industry giants, such as Microsoft and Vodafone, I led major digital transformations such as the modernization of Qatar's legacy systems. This required mastering complex technologies while navigating stakeholder expectations, securing cross-functional buy-in, and driving rapid executions.

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐃𝐗𝐰𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲
Founded in 2018, DXwand’s mission is to bridge the Arabic dialect gap in AI and empower businesses with AI that understands the region's unique cultural and linguistic landscape. 
Securing 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫 $6 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧 in funding, including a pivotal round during the 2023 downturn, validates both our innovative solutions and the region's readiness for our tailored AI. 

𝐈𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐓𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐩
Exceptional outcomes are only possible with a team driven by one vision. At Vodafone, for example, I was able to secure the company the Microsoft Gold Partner status while simultaneously driving a 30% revenue growth. This was achieved by fostering a culture of strategic thinking and continuous skill development. 

𝐒𝐮𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬, 𝐒𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐝 
I take pride in my role in transforming how sectors interact with their customers through strategic digital initiatives. 

• Consistently surpassing sales quotas (129%, 105% in consecutive years in Microsoft), demonstrating my ability to identify client pain points, develop tailored solutions, and execute strategies.
• My work across the Middle East and Africa (Qatar, UAE, Saudi Arabia, Tunisia, Palestine, Pakistan, Libya, Algeria, Morocco, Kuwait, Oman, Bahrain, Jordan, Lebanon, Nigeria, Kenya, South Africa, and more) has given me a nuanced understanding of diverse cultural and regulatory contexts. 
• Overcoming initial cloud adoption resistance across Qatar by successfully addressing security concerns and ensuring seamless technology transitions for government clients. 
• Spearheading the transformative launch of Qatar Virtual Learning Environment has enabled me to be part of the leading force behind revolutionizing education delivery across the Middle East region. 


What’s Next?
Together, we'll unlock the full potential of AI within the MENA region, driving your business towards sustainable, long-term growth.
Let's Chat! https://meeting.dxwand.com/Ahmed

name: Hari Sundram
title: Building an MGU platform to bring unique risk protection products to the A&H market
about:
Dr. Sundram is a serial entrepreneur who has previously  launched three companies that have raised a collectively over 800 million dollars and created more than 6 billion dollars in enterprise value by tackling problems in the small group health insurance space (Verikai - 6 million acquired for 120 million),  (Predilytics - 15 million acquired by Welltok for 80 million), and medical device arena (Auris Surgical Robotics - 800 Million and the first medical device unicorn acquired by J&J for 6 billion) while attracting some of the biggest names in healthcare.   He now hopes to transform all of premium creation and underwriting in the largest cause of individual bankruptcy in the US - group healthcare.

Verikai:  an applied data company leveraging a novel machine learning informed modeling platform to capture variance from regression in the insurance and financial services market.  

https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220118006231/en/American-Financial-Group-Inc.-Announces-Purchase-of-Verikai-Inc.

Auris Surgical Robotics:  Surgical Robotics company started with Fred Moll revolutionizing outpatient surgical intervention sold to J&J in April 2019:

https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-announces-completion-of-acquisition-of-auris-health-inc

Predilytics:  Consumer data and analytics to help insurers manage at risk lives. Sold to Welltok in May 2015:  

http://www.forbes.com/sites/zinamoukheiber/2015/05/19/welltok-gets-deeper-into-personalized-health-programs-with-predilytics-acquisition/

Currently Dr. Sundram is the founder and CEO of Radion Insurance, a level funded carrier providing affordable alternative to fully insured offerings in the small and mid group market off member level census only.  He is Chairman of the Board at Anagram (a consumer claiming platform for out of network benefits) and an active early stage investor and mentor in all things data driven.

Dr. Sundram completed his anesthesiology residency at U Penn and finished a fellowship in pain medicine at Massachusetts General Hospital this year.  He has published more than 10 papers in both basic science and clinical medicine.   Dr. Sundram has been nominated for 40 under 40 by the BBJ.  

Specialties: Capital raising, company formation, product creation and strategy, business development

name: Jakob Christensen
title: Founder/CEO @ Edify 💡 | We Help Brands Get More Subscribers on YouTube and Turn Them Into Leads 💰 | 100k+ Monthly Content Views Generated 🚀 | I talk about YouTube, social media and video
about:
😠 It doesn’t matter what industry you’re in. Chances are one of your competitors is killing it on social media with their videos. They’re blowing up on YouTube, IG, and TikTok, all at the same time.

They have attracted a substantial audience through consistently publishing new content, and they’re keeping them engaged by following the latest trends and delivering upfront value.

✋ Raise your hand if this is you -

You’re a business owner or marketing professional, providing services or products to a well-defined audience. You know your offers are solid and the value you provide is competitive. Your brand is trustworthy, it’s authoritative, and it’s driven by people that care about their customers.

🛑 But - you’re pulling your hair out.

Because you know another company serving the same space has focused on establishing a significant video presence, which means your competition has an unrivaled ecosystem of warm leads that already know, like, and trust their brand.

But don’t freak out.

💡 For years, Edify has provided video-first content services for high-profile brands, and through our focus on generating leads and retaining engaged subscribers, we have been part of growing numerous brands to 7 or 8 figures - and beyond.

We are proud of decades of proven results in a wide-range of different video solutions. We are on top of cutting-edge methods for building awareness, improving engagement, and nurturing an audience. 💡

Our partners benefit from this when we strategize, produce, distribute, and optimize their video content. 

🔥 We do 90% of the work for you, weaponizing our knowledge to grow your brand.

Just like we did with DigitalMarketer.com.

They currently have more than 60,000 active subscribers on their YouTube channel.

💰 That means whenever they release a new offer, they have a massive audience of warm leads. Our focus on producing high-value and engaging video-first content has ensured a steady pipeline of followers that are ready to give them their money.

Just listen to what their Founder and CEO Ryan Deiss has to say about us:

“I have worked with Jakob and his team on literally hundreds of hours of video content, from courses to live-streamed events, and their consistent commitment to quality and going that “extra mile” has not only given us an edge over the competition - it has flat out made us more sales.”

🚀 Your success and growth is our mission - and providing the video-first content services you need is how we're going to accomplish it.

name: Jerome Pesenti
title: Sizzle AI, Founder
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I have been involved with artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and search for the past 25 years. I most recently led the AI team at Meta -- pursuing fundamental and applied research in AI and making Meta products safer and more valuable to people through the use of AI. MetaAI's main contributions during my time there were PyTorch, AI for content moderation, very large models for ads and recommendations, and FAIR's research breakthroughs.

Previously I was co-CEO of BenevolentAI, which develops novel AI technologies that will change how drugs are discovered. Before that, I managed a global team of researchers and software engineers within IBM Watson. My team was doing research and developing state-of-the-art software in question and answering, dialog, speech, natural language processing, and automated machine translation. Our biggest research focus was on leveraging deep learning for all these tasks. We were also responsible for the Watson Developer Cloud, which exposes these technologies as easy-to-consume cloud services.

I joined IBM through its acquisition of Vivisimo, the search and text analytics company I co-founded in 2000. Vivisimo grew organically to 130 employees and had many large corporate and government customers such as P&G, Airbus, J&J, DIA, SSA, and the US Air Force. Vivisimo's technology was based on the machine learning research I conducted with my co-founders in the CS department of CMU from  1998 to 2000. 

On the policy side, I served as co-chair of an independent review on the growth of AI commissioned by the UK government. This report led to a sector deal - https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/artificial-intelligence-sector-deal/ai-sector-deal - and most of its recommendations have been since implemented by the UK government.
speaking_engagements: Interview with citybiz about Sizzle AI and funding; Guest on AI For All Podcast discussing AI in education; Featured on Pulse podcast discussing Sizzle AI virtual math tutor
notable_achievements: Former VP of AI at Meta, leading AI teams including development of PyTorch and large language models; Led AI research and applied teams at Facebook (Meta); Led global AI research team at IBM Watson; Founder of Sizzle AI, an AI tutoring chatbot startup
reasoning: Jerome Pesenti demonstrates a strong pattern of innovation leadership and market impact in AI, particularly through his co-founding of Vivisimo (acquired by IBM), leadership roles at major tech companies, and significant contributions to AI development. His experience combines successful entrepreneurship (Vivisimo exit), executive leadership at major tech companies (Meta AI, IBM Watson), and recognized thought leadership in AI (UK government AI review). The combination of a successful exit, leadership of major AI initiatives at top tech companies, and policy influence places him solidly at L6 as a Market Innovator and Thought Leader.

about:

name: Dave Johnston
title: Entrepreneur | Founder at Omnee
about:
There were a few times our utility services were cut off from overdue bills, and we would boil water to bathe. Twice, we pretended nobody was home when landlords came looking to collect their overdue rent, resulting in evictions. 

These unpleasant experiences put a chip on my shoulder at a young age. Even though I had so much to be thankful for, I swore to myself that someday my own family would never have to feel the shame I felt as a kid.

That said, throughout all those years of struggle, there were also neighbors randomly showing up with groceries for our family. There was the landlord who let us stay much longer than we should have. There was a kind farmer willing to drive my family 100's of km's when our rust bucket (barely a car) broke down on the side of the highway. 

I even remember, when I was about 10 yrs old, a generous local clothing retailer put my very first suit and tie on layaway, so I could slowly pay for it over several months with income from my flyer delivery route.

Back then, I wanted to wear that suit and tie proudly, as I thought that was what success looked like. 

After tasting some wins and losses over two decades as an entrepreneur, it's become increasingly clear that value is mostly found beneath the surface.

In a culture increasingly obsessed with appearances, I'm driven to make an impact that's deeper and more enduring.

I want to be like that farmer, landlord, clothing retailer or neighbour... where helping someone is a reflex, not a performance. I want to create tangible value, empowering others to live a meaningful life and enjoy what matters most.

I have all my chips in...to do it at scale! 
(except maybe the chip still on my shoulder)

Currently co-founder and CTO of Blink Identity, a Texas-based company specializing in facial recognition technology that identifies people at a full walking speed. At the nexus of growth and innovation, I bring a strategic approach to product development, global partnerships, and operational excellence. My focus is on empowering organizations to create transformative experiences and cultivating thriving communities, particularly within the wellness and technology sectors.

With a proven track record of managing full product lifecycles, I excel at translating ideas into market-ready solutions. From ideation to launch, I’ve led cross-functional teams across the U.S. and India to develop actionable strategies, define product requirements, and deliver exceptional outcomes in diverse markets.

My leadership style is rooted in collaboration, adaptability, and a relentless drive for innovation. I’m recognized for my ability to:

Think strategically: Aligning business goals with cutting-edge technologies.
Deliver results: Turning concepts into successful products that achieve measurable impact.
Build connections: Fostering partnerships that unlock new opportunities.
Passionate about driving sustainable growth and operational excellence, I am committed to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

Let’s collaborate to shape the future of your organization. Explore my portfolio: bit.ly/anithabeberg-portfolio

name: Michael D. Geer
title: Co-Founder @ Humanity | Applying AI & Data to Public Health
about:
As a kid, I wanted to make a positive change and move the world forward. I didn't want to do a job that just kept the status quo. My first thought was to be an astronaut. I went to Georgia Tech university for aerospace engineering (rocket science) to get closer to that dream. I did not end up reaching that goal immediately, but looks like I'll make it up there sooner than later. However, I think I have now found my way to truly bring humans a leap forward.
 
But first, let me describe how I got to this point. I learned the consumer internet industry from the ground up while helping build badoo.com in Moscow and then set up the London office, constructing Badoo piece by piece scaling from 0 to 70 million users. And then moved on to build AnchorFree from a popular single app company when I joined, to the lead global protector of the Internet with over 700 million users and hundreds of millions in yearly subscription revenue. Leveraging all those skills/experience, I have now embarked on the mission of my life by Co-founding Humanity with my close friend Peter Ward.

Humanity will let the people of the world fight aging damage that robs us of a healthy long life and countless friends and family members. Just in the last 5 years the scientific community has made incredible steps forward in our understanding of what drives loss of function in our bodies over time (aging). We will become a distributor of these solutions, feed data back into the research community and for the first time give our users a concrete feedback loop to track the effectiveness of each intervention/solution.

I believe the internet's ability to distribute knowledge and real power can drastically improve people's lives and work every day to make this happen.

Feel free to contact me to discuss ideas.

name: Peter Ward
title:
Co-Founder & CEO of Humanity - On a mission to extend healthspan. 
Founder. CEO. Investor. Board Member. Speaker. Community Builder.
about:
As the co-founder and CEO of Humanity, I am on a mission to extend the healthspan of humanity and give back 1 billion years to the world by the end of this decade. I lead a team of passionate and talented professionals who are building the #1 health and longevity app platform that leverages AI and longitudinal health data to monitor people’s rate of aging and biological age, and guides them to slow it down, and even reverse it, based on what’s working for people like them.

With over 20 years of experience as a founder, CEO, investor, board member, speaker, and community builder, I have a proven track record of creating and scaling innovative and impactful ventures in the tech and health sectors. I am also a co-founder and board director of ICE List, one of the leading tech entrepreneurs networks in Europe, and a non-executive director of Ocean Bottle, a mission-driven brand for ocean health. I enjoy meeting and bringing together entrepreneurs, leaders, creatives, and people with purpose, and supporting the entrepreneurship community and inspiring others to make a dent in the world. I am fascinated by technology's impact on humanity and how we can make the world a better place.
speaking_engagements: The Future of Valuation – Navigating Volatility in Emerging Markets, Feb 12, 2025; Genomics and Digital Therapeutics, the Future of Personalized Medicine, Feb 10, 2025; The Rise of Forgotten Markets: Unlocking Hidden Opportunities, Feb 9, 2025
notable_achievements: Co-founder of Humanity, a leading health and longevity app; Founder and leader of Sviraci folk-dance band; Owner and developer of Happiness Country Kennels

name: Andy Liu
title: Partner at Unlock Venture Partners - early stage technology fund focused on Seattle and Los Angeles
about:
Andy Liu is a co-founding partner of Unlock Venture Partners. He is a
serial entrepreneur, most recently as a co-founder and CEO of BuddyTV
(acquired by Vizio). Prior to BuddyTV, Andy was
the co-founder and CEO of NetConversions which was acquired by
aQuantive (AQNT), where he then served as VP & GM, Atlas
NetConversions. Andy had previously worked in a variety of roles at
Active Voice, Safeware, Boeing, and AT&T. He also serves on the
non-profit board of Future Hope, which provides technology and
leadership education to the impoverished and marginalized.

Andy has been a very active early-stage investor in technology
companies, mostly in the Pacific Northwest, with over 90 investments
in companies such as Cheezburger Network, SoFi, Redfin (RDFN), Buuteeq
(acquired by Priceline), Minted, Remitly, Amperity, Rover, and Sparq
(acquired by Yahoo). He has been named 40 under 40 in 2003,
Seattle Angel of the Year in 2010, Innovator of the Year by Asian
NW Weekly in 2016, and PSBJ's Power 100 in 2019 . Andy is also a former President of Entrepreneur's
Organization Seattle.

Andy earned a BS, Electrical Engineering from Seattle Pacific
University and an MBA from the Wharton School of Business. He has
lived in Seattle for over 40 years and knows all the best places to
eat. You may find him dining at The Fat Hen where he is a partner and
part-owner.
speaking_engagements: Guest on FNO: InsureTech Podcast discussing AI and drone technology in insurance

name: Tariq Kassum
title: Biotech executive
about:
I'm a company builder, leader, and creator, working at the intersection of science and business. There are three things I love to do most: work with brilliant teams on new scientific ideas; solve tricky business problems; and create smart transactions that link the strength of pharma with the creativity of biotech.

I started as a stock analyst covering the biotech industry but moved to operating companies 15 years ago and have not looked back. With the support of some amazing teams, I was the head of BD for Takeda's oncology franchise, I helped start Obsidian Therapeutics, and I was CEO of Celsius Therapeutics which was acquired by AbbVie in 2024. 

The most important thing I have learned is that while a company may have multiple stakeholders – employees, investors, etc. – the patients always come first. And if you do the right thing for the patients, good things happen for everyone.
notable_achievements: Co-founder and former COO of Obsidian Therapeutics; Appointed CEO of Celsius Therapeutics in 2019; Played a central role in Obsidian's strategic partnership with Celgene; Led Takeda Oncology's business development and strategy, managing multiple acquisitions and divestitures
