name: Bob Gaydos
title: Founder and CEO of Pendella
about:
Bob is the founder and CEO of Pendella Technologies. Pendella’s embedded, white-label individual life and disability insurance solution empowers distributors and carriers to easily offer affordable life and disability insurance options to their customers. The technology automates the underwriting process through the power of artificial intelligence and big data, creating a seamless and highly intuitive policy-buying experience where consumers can buy a policy completely online in minutes without a medical exam. 

Bob is a successful entrepreneur and recognized insurance benefits expert.  

Early in Bob’s career, he established himself as an innovator. As a co-founder of Choice Plus of New England, he pioneered the development of level-funded health plans. Bob successfully exited that company in 2006 when it was acquired by Medical Claims Service. After the exit, Bob stayed active in the field by consulting the industry on health plan designs and funding.

During that same period, Bob was a national leader in consumer-driven health plans. As a co-founder of Choice Strategies, he launched the nation’s first debit card-based HRA. Then, the company developed the ability to integrate the employer-provided HRA with the employee’s HSA and FSA. Today, these technologies and personal care accounts are a staple in nearly every employer-sponsored benefit plan in the US.  Bob successfully exited that company in 2012 when it was acquired by WageWorks (now a part of HealthEquity). After the exit, Bob stayed active in the field by consulting InsurTechs, health plans, and employers on the further development of the technology that would bring these plans to the masses.

Over the last 10 years, Bob has founded, invested, advised, and operated innovative companies in the benefit & insurance industry. Maxwell Health: an online benefits administration platform acquired by Sun Life in 2018. Connected Benefits: an online insurance agency acquired by GoHealth in 2016. Limelight Health: a group underwriting platform acquired by Fineos in 2020. GoCo: an online platform for HR, benefits, and payroll. Ideon (formerly Vericred): an innovative data services platform powering digital quote-to-card experiences in health insurance and benefits.
speaking_engagements: Podcast episode on Recruiting Daily discussing Pendella and individual life and health insurance coverage; Guest on The Art of Entrepreneurship podcast, episode 219
notable_achievements: Founder and CEO of Pendella, automating underwriting through AI and big data; Founded multiple companies acquired by major firms (Maxwell Health by Sun Life, Connected Benefits by GoHealth, Limelight Health by Fineos)
reasoning: Bob Gaydos demonstrates a clear pattern of serial entrepreneurship with multiple successful exits and company building. He has founded, scaled, and exited several significant companies in the insurance/benefits space, with at least 3 documented successful exits. His track record shows consistent ability to identify market opportunities, build innovative solutions, and achieve meaningful exits. The companies he's founded or been involved with have created lasting impact in their respective sectors, particularly in benefits technology and insurance innovation. His pattern of success spans over 15+ years, showing sustained ability to build and exit valuable companies.

name: Bramh Awasthi
title: MD - Whirlybird Electronics Pvt Ltd (We're are hiring!)
about:
Bramh Awasthi is Founder and Managing Director for a Mumbai-based technology company, Whirlybird Electronics. Whirlybird was founded in June 2004 at IIT Kanpur and the company has done extensive work in power electronics, signal processing, sensors and controls. Bramh and his team at Whirlybird have proven experience in conceptualising, designing, developing, testing, and manufacturing high technology products. Their portfolio of products includes inertial navigation systems for defence applications, automatic weather stations, power converters for solar applications, electronic hardware for micro-grids, and data-loggers for monitoring remote activities.

Bramh’s work on improved method for loudspeaker testing, completed during his student internship (2003) at Bose Corporation, was implemented at all of Bose’s manufacturing plants. His Bachelor’s thesis work on autonomous control of helicopters (2004) led to his first project with the Indian Navy. Bramh has been an invited lecturer on innovation and entrepreneurship at many universities around the world including the IITs in India and École Centrale de Paris.

Bramh received his Bachelors in Aeronautical Engineering from IIT Kanpur (2004). Bramh lives in Mumbai.

Specialties: Inertial Navigation System and Guidance, Power Electronics, IOT Gateways
notable_achievements: Managing Director of Whirlybird Electronics, a company with reported revenue and financial data

name: Daniel Huss
title: Founder at gravityAI
about:
In another life I should have been a physicist. That’s out of the question now, so I try to fake it by It by applying as much scientific method as I can to product development and entrepreneurship. This has led me to value uncertainty and ambiguity, and have a default setting to “build, measure, learn.” 
 
When an organization decides to embark on using technology, specifically AI, to introduce a new product  to their customer base, they often fail to cross the chasm between “research project” and “desirable product.” I bridge that gap by embodying the values above, being the voice of the customer ad nauseam, evangelizing cross-functional development teams, and relentlessly testing. 
 
I happen to do these things currently as the Head of Product Management for Verus within State Street Corporation. Prior to making the jump to STT, I  laid the foundation for the very product I’m building now with Boston Consulting Group, Digital Ventures.

name: Aaron Peabody
title: Co-Founder & CEO at Untitled
about:
I'm a Co-Founder and the CEO of Untitled, an audience platform built to help marketers cut wasted spend and drive better performance—by turning owned data into high-performing audiences.

We’re solving the messy, complicated, and unscalable workflows between systems of record (CRMs, CDPs, POS, ESPs, etc.), identity resolution, data enrichment, and media activation—so brands can build smarter audiences without stitching together half a dozen disconnected tools, and better leverage the best of AI in advertising contexts.

I'm an entrepreneur through and through. My background has largely been in early-stage technology companies and fast-growing businesses. Along the way, I’ve built a wide range of skills helping scale technologies, teams, and organizations. Over the past decade, I’ve seen firsthand how much time and money gets lost trying to make first/second/third-party data usable across platforms—and that problem has been my focus, in one form or another, for most of my career.

Always happy to connect with founders, marketers, operators, and anyone building in and around data, identity, AI or media.

name: Lauren Washington
title: Entrepreneur | Startup Program Leader | Ecosystem Builder | Speaker | Advisor
about:
Lauren is the cofounder of Black Women Talk Tech, Talk Tech Association and Fundr.  

Founded in 2017, Black Women Talk Tech’s mission is to help black women create the next billion dollar business. In a few years, it became the largest conference for black women founders and spun off to Black Men Talk Tech in 2019. It extended its mission by creating a non-profit, Talk Tech Association, which has since grown to local cities chapters around the world. 

Given her experiences with fundraising and hearing stories from the hundreds of women she’s worked with, Lauren created Fundr in 2019, a platform that automates seed investing by creating portfolios of vetted startups for angel investors. 

Her companies have won multiple awards including 43North, the largest global business competition and the Advanced Imaging Society’s Distinguished Leadership Award. She has been featured in The New York Times, Elle, Inc and Black Enterprise and has been listed as a top female entrepreneur in CIO Magazine, Essence Magazine and Entrepreneur Magazine.

Lauren started her career as a special education teacher with Teach for America and went on to develop marketing and data strategy for over 100 global companies. She started her entrepreneurial journey with her first company, KeepUp, a social listening platform. 

She has her BA from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and her MBA from Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management. She is on the board of advisors for SXSW Pitch and is the board chair of Talk Tech Association.

name: Daniel Kovařík
title: CTO and Co-Founder at LokiBots
about:
As the Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer of LokiBots, I bring over 10 of experience in developing and leading innovative AI and software solutions. With a strong background in machine learning and Python, I have played a key role in driving the development of cutting-edge AI/ML solutions and most importantly building functional products based on them. Additionally, I have extensive experience in developing Python back-ends and implementing user interfaces.

Prior to my current position, I co-founded Bohemian AI where I served as a Machine Learning Developer and Project Manager. During my time at Bohemian AI, I honed my skills in AI solutions for companies, with a particular focus on computer vision projects.

Before entering the world of AI, I specialized in front-end development, working with high-profile clients in the Czech Republic. As a result, I have a deep understanding of JavaScript applications and interfaces, further bolstering my expertise in software development.

Overall, my diverse experience and technical skills make me well-equipped to take on any challenge in the realm of machine learning, AI, and software development. I am passionate about leveraging technology to make a difference and am excited to continue driving innovation in the field.

name: Anthony Chang
title: Chief Intelligence and Innovation Officer at Rady Children's Health. Founder of AIMed and author of Intelligence-Based Medicine. Global Convener of Passionate People for Transformation.
about:
Passionate advocate for use of artificial intelligence and innovation in medicine to transform global healthcare for both children and adults. 

Anthony Chang, MD, MBA, MPH, MS is a pediatric cardiologist and Medical Director of the Heart Failure Program at Children’s Hospital of Orange County.  Dr. Chang serves as Chief Intelligence and Innovation Officer of CHOC Sharon Disney Lund Medical Intelligence, Information, Investigation and Innovation Institute (Mi4). The Institute is the hub of medical intelligence and innovation at CHOC, and also serves as a national and international leader. Mi4 was the first institute of its kind in a children’s hospital. Dr. Chang completed his Master of Science (MS) in Data Science with a sub-specialization in artificial intelligence from Stanford School of Medicine and has completed a certification on artificial intelligence from MIT. Dr. Chang has a Master’s in Business Administration (MBA) in Health Care Administration from the University of Miami School of Business and a Master’s in Public Health (MPH) in Health Care Policy from the Jonathan Fielding School of Public Health of the University of California, Los Angeles.

Dr. Chang is the founder of the Pediatric Cardiac Intensive Care Society (PCICS) and the founder of the Asia-Pacific Pediatric Cardiac Society (APPCS).  He started a pediatric innovation leadership group whose bi-annual symposium Pediatrics2040: Emerging Trends and Future Innovations has become a catalyst for the International Society for Pediatric Innovation (iSPI).  Each summer, the Mi4 Summer Internship Program, founded by Dr. Chang, mentors close to 75 young future clinicians. Dr. Chang’s book, Intelligence-Based Medicine is the first of its kind textbook on AI in medicine and is used at colleges and universities around the globe. He is the founder and organizing chair of several Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (AI Med) that hosts meetings in the U.S. and abroad (Europe and Asia) focusing on artificial intelligence in healthcare and medicine (www.ai-med.io). He is also the founder the Medical Intelligence Society (MIS), the American Board of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (ACAIM), and the Alliance of Centers in Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (ACAIM) and the Pediatric Centers of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (PCAIM), now with nearly 100 participating centers from around the globe.

name: Richard Starson
title: Building the future 🇺🇸🚀🇺🇸
about:
I am an entrepreneur and scientist passionate about advanced technologies, space exploration and applications of physics and machine learning tools for building a sustainable and exciting future for America.

I got my Ph.D. in astrophysics from Caltech working with Chris Hirata on the physics of early Universe. I hold a M.Sc. in physics from Carleton University, where I studied particle physics. I am a graduate of the Singularity University and an alumnus of an executive program at MIT Sloan. My research in physics and astrophysics included work at Harvard University and the Space Telescope Science Institute. 

After completing my Ph.D. at Caltech I became the CEO & CTO of Escape Dynamics - a startup focused on the development of a microwave-powered space launch system. Escape Dynamics operated from 2011 to 2016 and was focused on a moonshot vision of enabling the world's first single-stage-to-orbit space plane. In 2015 we successfully demonstrated an engine operating with efficiency above the limits of chemical rockets. 

After Escape Dynamics I joined SRI International in a dual role of a director at Advanced Technologies and System Division and an Entrepreneur in Residence at SRI Ventures. 

From SRI I spun out Passio Inc - an AI company specializing in on-device machine learning and real-time user insights. Our first product is a Nutrition-AI platform that enables companies and developers to rapidly build and deploy AI-powered food tracking and nutrition coaching applications.
experience_2_title: Principal Innovator and Entrepreneur in Residence

name: Nikhil Mendhi
title: President & COO, Exponential AI | AI-First Growth Strategist  | Proven PE Operator & Board Leader | Transformational HealthTech Executive I M&A
about:
I believe healthcare deserves better—faster innovation, smarter systems, and equitable access driven by purpose-built technology. As an AI-first HealthTech leader, my mission has always been clear: to harness intelligent automation to solve real-world challenges for payers, providers, and patients.

I’m a seasoned healthcare executive with 20+ years of leadership experience spanning payers, providers, and PBMs—focused on building high-performing organizations that accelerate growth, unlock value, and scale responsibly in complex, highly regulated environments.

At HM Health Solutions, I led Product Development and Go-to-Market strategy for one of the industry’s most ambitious platform plays—supporting over 10 million members and scaling the business to a $1B enterprise in just four years. It remains a foundational case in payer technology transformation.

At Exponential AI, I served as President & COO, driving the company’s transformation from a services-led firm to a product-first, AI-native enterprise. Under my leadership, we delivered 6× growth in recurring revenue, a 40% improvement in EBITDA, and successfully raised growth capital to scale our platform portfolio and expand market reach.

Across my career, I’ve built and led globally distributed, cross-functional teams across product, engineering, GTM, finance, and operations—supported by a trusted international network of legal, infrastructure, and commercial experts. Together, we’ve delivered transformation at scale while positioning companies for strategic growth and successful exits.

My core expertise spans AI productization, M&A execution, platform scaling, capital strategy, and enterprise transformation. Whether driving value-based care innovation, leading post-acquisition integration, or restoring investor confidence, I bring a rare blend of strategic clarity and operational discipline.

I’m passionate about challenging the status quo, aligning teams around bold, shared vision, and delivering measurable impact. I frequently share insights at HIMSS, AHIP, Beckers, HFS, and AiMed, and am recognized for bridging deep healthcare domain knowledge with commercially scalable innovation.

I’m now focused on leading the next generation of PE-backed or high-growth HealthTech ventures—organizations bold enough to reimagine the future of care through digital health, intelligent automation, and payer-provider transformation, and disciplined enough to deliver it with measurable outcomes, operational rigor, and system-wide impact.

notable_achievements: Co-founder of Zerodha, one of India's leading discount brokerage firms; Recognized as one of India's youngest billionaires
reasoning: The founder demonstrates strong executive experience in healthcare technology with proven operational success at scale. While impressive, there's no clear evidence of personal exits >$100M or founding multiple successful ventures. The profile shows strong operational execution and leadership but fits best in the L4 category as a proven operator with executive experience at notable companies.

name: Sumit Gupta
title: CTO / Co-Founder at DoubleLoop
about:
I have been fortunate to have had the opportunity to build, scale, and lead engineering and products teams. 

I have been in the trenches of scaling an application from a few hundred users to 10s of millions, and am well-versed in what that takes--both from the product side of designing and authoring software, to the leadership side of the growing effective teams. 

Things that are important to me: 
* Building a team, not collecting talent. 
* The environment has to be conducive to great work or even the best people will be ineffective. 
* I subscribe to the "Show How, Don't Tell What" leadership philosophy. I believe it is not only more effective for team members to learn but also lets me have opportunities to stay close to the code. This enables me to not lose sight of what day-to-day life for all team members is like. 
* Leadership can and should come from all parts of the team and the cultivated environment should be a forcing function towards that goal. 
* Proven methodologies like pragmatic pair programming, strong automated testing culture, and automation throughout the stack, from operations to day-to-day coding. 
* There are no company/hr processes that can replace reliance on personal responsibility, myself included.
speaking_engagements: Host of the Choosing Leadership podcast where he interviews industry leaders such as Bharani, CEO of 91mobiles.com; Author of leadership and management articles focusing on authenticity and leadership challenges

A PhD/MBA (Dr.Eng.) from Texas A&M, in the field of EE (electromagnetics) with emphasis on MRI antennae and masters thesis in RF hyperthermia led to employment in the MRI industry and rise to Director of Operations of a company now publicly traded.  Started two companies, received numerous FDA 510k product approvals, over 20 US patents, Development grants, SBIR grants, and one NIH grant as well as over 80 medical device designs - all largely financed through organic growth.  
After founding and growing ScanMed LLC to become the independently owned world leader in the industry of MRI antennae repair and refurbishment while designing next generation of anatomically specific antennae for OEMs and hospitals, Jones sold ScanMed in Sept 202 and moved on to his next challenge: growing Bot Image, Inc. a leader in Prostate Cancer detection, diagnosis and screening using AI interpretation of MRI.

name: Israel Krush
title: CEO & Co-Founder at Hyro | Transforming Healthcare with Responsible AI Agents
about:
A lifelong lover of solving puzzles and problems, I’ve always been fascinated by gathering data, understanding its complexities, and discovering how it impacts the real world.

After receiving my BSc in Computer Science and Statistics from Tel Aviv University, I entered the startup world as a software developer, later moving into product management. I guess my childhood inclination to be a part of a ton of extracurriculars led me to get my MBA from Cornell Tech, and eventually pursue entrepreneurship and to become a CEO.

I founded Hyro in 2018 to enable enterprises to deploy and maintain virtual assistants at scale. Since then, we are developing the world’s first Adaptive Communications Platform that makes it easy, fast, and scalable to deploy virtual assistants that improve engagement, operational efficiency, and conversions by helping people have two-way conversations.

It’s an honor to work with Microsoft, Twilio, SCL Health, RentPath, and so many more inspiring companies to improve their business outcomes through our adaptive communications platform. In our constantly digitizing world, these tools are more important than ever.

“Hyro is a differentiator for our business, vastly improving patients’ experience by making it easy to access information and take actionable next steps across the digital channels of their choice” (Amber Fencl, VP Digital Health & Engagement at Novant Health)

“We’ve been able to focus on quality lead management at scale in order to win more leases. Existing solutions could not be adapted to our specific use case; we found that Hyro was the perfect partner to build something specific to Carroll that scales across our portfolio” (Noah Echols, VP Marketing, Carroll Property Management)

If you’re looking to expand what your contact center, website and chat currently provide, we’d love to work with you.

name: Rom Cohen
title: Co-Founder & COO at Hyro | Revolutionizing Conversational AI
about:
An engineer at heart, I’m always on the hunt for a good problem to solve. For example, understanding a person's intent from their natural language input, or figuring out how to turn complex information into simple dialogue. 
I've been obsessed with customer experience for as long as I can remember. So naturally, I got pretty excited when chatbots first came on to the scene, only to be mildly disappointed. 
The chatbots that we’re used to typically follow a flow chart of logic that points the bot towards specific answers, allowing very little room for a personalized experience for the user. What if that pre-set answer doesn’t actually solve the problem? Enter Hyro.ai. 
We’ve developed a natural language processing engine that adapts to communication and provides responses that are adapted to the user’s inquiry specifically which we’re seeing lead to higher satisfaction rates, more efficient conversations, and above all - higher profitability. 
It’s our company’s mission to prove that chatbots don't have to suck. If you're curious about how to automate interactions on any channel (internal or external), then let's connect and chat!

name: Steve Chapman
title: Building #1 hydration brand @ Hyro 💦 | FMCG/DTC Advisor & Investor 🚀 | Previously built @ Shine Drink ⚡
about:
Started Hyro with a question: why are 4 out of 5 Australians still dehydrated, even though everyone gets told to just drink more water?

Turns out it’s not more water... it’s more electrolytes in your water that’s the unlock. So we built Hyro — a hydration brand backed by athletes, creators, and operators like Sarah’s Day, Quade Cooper, Daly Cherry-Evans and other legends.

Since launch, we’ve cracked multi-seven figures, built an all-star team, moved offices (twice), had a baby, got married- and we’re just getting started.

Before Hyro, I was co-founder & CEO of Shine Drink — we scaled to 7,000+ stores, hit $60M+ in retail sales, and won a Telstra Business Award along the way. I also built a Facebook Marketplace-style app before Facebook did (RIP FaceBuy).

These days, I’m all in on building Hyro into a $100M+ brand while trying to be a great dad, run a sub 3-hour marathon, and survive waking up at 424am everyday.

🧱 Watch the journey on YouTube (Building Hyro) - www.youtube.com/@stevechapman424
📈 Follow the chaos and lessons here on LinkedIn
🎯 Goal: build the most loved hydration brand 

Let’s go. To the moon 🚀

name: J. Foster Davis
title: Founder & COO.  Damn the torpedoes.
about:
I lead diverse teams to meet the biggest challenges in cybersecurity, technology, and risk management.  Cyber risk is just like any other risk - so treat it the same.  If you grow a culture of risk management, accountability, and self-inspection - you are on track to building a secure organization.

I believe in the power of "Red Teaming" (scrimmaging to "attack" your ideas, projects, and organization - making them stronger).  It supports a culture of self-reflection, thought diversity, and risk management that is necessary to create a secure organization. I believe in it so much that I've staked my livelihood on it by co-founding BreachBits, a cyber Red Teaming company that uses automation and AI to do things that humans can't. 

I am inspired by the Liberty-related disciplines of complexity science, performance art, Austrian economics, cybersecurity, capitalism, and organizational theory.  There is a reason these approaches rich in civil liberty produce the best results. 
-> Seek mutual value and respect in your relationships and partnerships. 
-> Lead not by requiring compliance but allowing for initiative.  
-> Regulate not by policing but by interaction.  
-> Do not compel; voluntary efforts will produce an abundance of successful outcomes.  
-> Focus your energy not on catching a culprit, but on recognizing and encouraging goodness.  
-> Defend yourself and your ideas.  They are worth defending.
-> Do not lie to yourself or others - else you will become a slave.  Instead, speak the truth, embolden the truth in others, and face the truth - using it... conquering it.

I'm a proud Arkansan interested in cultivating the world-class technology and talent potential of my home state. I've been all around the world and there are few places with such a proven record in business, technology, and innovation. I listed this fact last because as those in the know understand: we Arkansans are a proud, powerful, but humble people.  We speak with results, not "big belt buckles."

name: William Brendel
title: Multi-Award Winning Organization Development Educator, Author, and Consultant. Founder of OpenSourceOD.
about:
Founder of OpenSourceOD.com - a resource and community dedicated to democratizing Organization Development (OD) knowledge for all those who yearn to facilitate positive change.

With over 25 years of global OD consulting experience, I have dedicated my career to elevating the strategic performance of organizations committed to human-centered innovation. As an OD practitioner, my success is reflected in:

• Facilitating strategic breakthroughs in internal processes and external services
• Coaching leaders to inspire creativity and commitment amongst employees
• Transforming key aspects of the employee lifecycle
• Exceeding stakeholder expectations

AWARDS

• 2021 Lisa Kimball Award: Recognized for creating the first validated OD competency assessment, used by 2,000+ professionals and adopted by the OD Network.
• 2023 OD Review Article of the Year: Awarded for developing an OD career approach used by organizations like the Ontario Healthcare System.
• 2024 Larry Porter Award: Celebrated for making OD understandable and strategic. 
• 2024 JSMR Article of the Year: Recognized for a leadership assessment adopted by HR Business Partners at organizations like Medtronic.

INNOVATIONS

• OD Immersives: Real-world video simulations based on case studies by Ed Schein, Frances Baldwin,  Peter Block,widely used to navigate complexity.
• OD Competency Assessment (MOST): Assesses critical OD competencies, integral to the OD Network's Global Competency Framework.

name: Ori Keren
title: Co-founder & CEO at LinearB (linearb.io)
about:
If you’ve been in software for a while, think of a time when your team was operating at its best. Quick execution, fast-paced delivery, everyone knew what they needed to do.

As an ex-VP of Engineering at Cloudlock ($293M exit), I discovered there’s no better feeling as an engineering leader than enabling your team to be happy with their work and deliver efficiently with the highest quality. That’s why I co-founded LinearB and serve as its CEO. We want to give organizations the ability to work like this all the time.

I believe we’re at the forefront of the next golden age of software development. Organizations are starting to understand that when you measure the right metrics and improve dev workflow with automation, you begin seeing an uptick in developer productivity, and happiness.

I’ve been calling this ETA:
– Experience: Developer Experience meaning how easy is it for a developer to implement a task?
– Tempo: Are we executing with high velocity and quality?
– Alignment: Are we investing in the right things?

I’m proud of the work we have done to help teams become more data-driven while providing the tools for dev teams to continuously improve. If you want to save your developers time and take the next steps to improve your org, reach out to us and we’ll be happy to help.

Learn more:
https://linearb.io/
https://linearb.io/dev/gitstream/

name: Vivek Date
title: I Am The Walrus
about:
As an Astute Storyteller and Visionary Product Builder, I thrive at the dynamic intersection of technology, creativity, and business strategy. With over 12 years of experience translating ambitious ideas into impactful realities, I am passionate about creating world-class products that solve real-world problems. 

My professional journey began with a business, a businessman and the team at Custodial I'll always hold in deep regards. As a Management Trainee my initial work experience (2013-2016) provided a strong foundation. I gained deep domain knowledge from building Justdial's Search Plus platform, with expertise in E-Commerce & Payment Gateways. 

At 25, in 2016 I found myself at a profound crossroads, faced with two distinct paths to pursue my passion for Music & Performance Arts as a livelihood: to Confirm to the Conventional (to enter Bollywood), or to leave the country. I chose the road less traveled. Over the next six years, I embraced a global stage, touring 17 countries  and performing in over 1,000 concerts across 50+ cities. This incredible journey not only allowed me to realize my musical ambitions  but also honed my storytelling abilities, instilled a deep appreciation for connecting with diverse audiences, and returned me home with a partner, a pet dog, and the deep satisfaction of a hard-earned ambition.

Since 2022, my focus has shifted back to product innovation, driven by an ambition as strong and a unique sense of déjà vu. As I now immerse myself in building efficient products and managing profitable businesses, I once again perceive two clear options for scaling: 'Confirm to the Conventional' (..I'll leave this to your guess) or 'Leave the Country.' 

My chosen path, however, mirrors my past decision to 'leave the country': it's about creating the kind of world-class jobs and opportunities here in India which contributes towards building world-class products. This is the fuel of my ambition. 

This philosophy fuels my commitment to building Walrus, an innovative SaaS platform for business companions.

Let's connect if you're passionate about innovation in AI, product development, or just a good story

name: Ian Seiferling
title: Co-Founder & Co-CEO | Adaviv | AI X Agriculture, Systems Thinking, Ecological Intelligence
about:
I'm Co-Founder and Co-CEO at Adaviv, an MIT spinout working at the edge of plant science, AI, sensing, decision making and applied systems. Likely from growing up in and around nature, I’ve always been drawn to the complexity of living systems - biological, ecological, human - and the ways we can use new technologies to better understand, guide and collaborate with them.

At Adaviv, we’re building practical technologies that give specialty crop growers visibility and feedback on how their plants and people are performing - in real-time, at scale. Our tools help reduce waste, improve consistency and quality, and unlock new ways to grow better crops and build better farm systems.

I’ve worked across biology, environmental science, data science and design - with a Ph.D. and postdoc research at MIT - but what keeps me going is a fascination with what’s coming next. With AI now accelerating at a wild pace, we’re stepping into a new era of collaboration between people and synthetic intelligence. I think how we build that world is critical to human existence and the earth - including how we grow food in it.

I've been a researcher, writer, consultant, and photographer. My work’s been published in journals and featured in Smithsonian, The Guardian, WSJ, and others. But I’m still driven by the same early pull: to explore and create systems that are more intelligent, more responsive, and more alive.

I am a Co-Founder and CEO of Hue.Ai, a fast-growing AI company developing next-gen optical and color management products and software. We developed HUE, an AI that solves pain points for various industries (optical, cosmetics, plastics, paint, automotive, etc). Our primary optical product is a clear lens that corrects color vision deficiency for 300 million people. We are also developing clear blue-light blocking lenses to protect the retina. 

Previously, I commercially directed 3 GW of renewable generation assets for NextEra Energy, an energy giant. I also led economic analysis on power markets, utility regulation and environmental policy at Charles River Associates and a state regulatory agency.

Graduated from Harvard's Kennedy School of Government with a focus on power sector finance and economics.

At SmartHop, I lead the organization towards its goal of leveling the playing field in the trucking industry for small carriers.

name: Joaquin Brillembourg
title: Strategic Product Leader | Cultural Marketer | Brand-Driven Builder | 0→1 Specialist | Turning Curiosity into Meaning
about:
I am curious enough to start anything and structured enough to finish the ones that matter. I once read that entrepreneurship is “bringing social change by modifying patterns, driven by holding on to an anomaly.” That idea has guided me for over 20 years: spotting what others overlook and following it wherever it leads.

My work focuses on turning cultural insights and raw ideas into structured systems that teams can build from. I look for tensions people feel but don’t articulate, then design products and frameworks that resolve those tensions with meaning. The goal is to help teams move with clarity while creating things that resonate.

I’ve applied this across logistics, education, fashion, games, and tech, leading ventures from concept to traction. Depending on the context, I work through strategy, product design, game mechanics, or cultural marketing. I use whatever tools the idea demands.

Along the way, I’ve come to see that resonance sits at the intersection of what a product does and what it represents. Cultural marketing taught me that meaning must be embedded in the brand from the beginning. Product design showed me how to shape utility into something intuitive and elegant. Game development taught me that even small interactions can carry emotional weight when they’re designed with care. Strategic leadership taught me how to keep teams focused when the direction is unclear and aligned when the stakes are high.

I'm looking to partner with companies who build with intention. I bring experience in translating complexity into actionable solutions and designing effective strategies that matter to real people.
speaking_engagements: Guest on FreightWaves Insiders podcast discussing SmartHop and the trucking industry
notable_achievements: Curated a museum-quality ensemble of legendary masterworks in the Brillembourg-Capriles Collection
reasoning: Based on available information, this founder appears to be an early-stage entrepreneur with some experience but limited concrete evidence of major scale or exits. Their background shows entrepreneurial activity with [Not] Bored Games and a solid educational foundation in Industrial Engineering. Their professional description demonstrates strategic thinking and product development experience across multiple sectors (logistics, education, fashion, games, tech), but lacks specific metrics or achievements that would qualify for higher classifications. The founder's articulate understanding of product development, cultural marketing, and team leadership suggests they're beyond L1, but without clear evidence of major funding rounds, exits, or significant scale achievements, they best fit the L2 classification.

name: Arthur Wang
title: Data @ Babylist
about:
I help organizations get value from their data - even if they don't know it exists. Consulting experience across industries helps me home in on business objectives to find the "why". Broad experience in analytics - including AI/ML, data engineering, and cloud architecture - informs the "what" and the "how".

I lead and deliver projects by understanding current and future business needs, then designing and implementing solutions to meet those needs. I seek to balance the urgent needs of the present with the aspirations of the future.

When drawing up solutions, I favor a design-first approach that combines experience (getting my hands dirty) and formal learning (reading papers and books). I'm an advocate for technology-agnostic, principles-based design in the early stages of projects, but also get hands-on once the project gets rolling. My skillset includes:

• Python and SQL (Spark SQL, Snowflake)
• Databricks and Apache Spark for data engineering and advanced analytics
• AWS (S3, Lambda, API Gateway, Kinesis, networking, IAM)
• Microsoft Azure (Data Factory, Data Lake Store, DevOps, Event Hub, and Stream Analytics)
• Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Terragrunt)
• Data architecture and pipelines for big data workloads (data lake/lakehouse architecture, lambda architecture, Apache Airflow)
• CI/CD and automation (Python, Bash, and PowerShell scripting, Azure Pipelines)
• Data modeling: dimensional modeling, entity-centric modeling
education_2_degree: Bachelor of Arts - BA, Political Science, Anthropology, Environmental Studies
speaking_engagements: Author for Entrepreneur Leadership Network, writing on entrepreneurship and business leadership
notable_achievements: National Merit Scholar Winner; National AP Scholar with distinction; Founder of ForSocialGoods club promoting youth volunteerism; Second prize and youngest finalist at 2019 Young Concert Artists International Auditions; Third grand prize winner in 2020 Chicago International Music Competition; Named in CBC Music’s 2017 list of '30 hot Canadian classical musicians under 30'; Co-founder of Hill & Wang publishing house, known for publishing significant literary and historical works

name: Mete Oğuzhan Öztürk
title: I build devices to keep people alive.
about:
I’m the Co-Founder and CTO of Stroma, a Chicago based startup focused to solve distracted driving related accidents. In this role I lead our research efforts in optics, computer vision and deep learning, and help my co-founder Anıl in our effort to grow.

Before founding Stroma, I worked at the Koc University Microphotonics Research Laboratory and KWorks (Koc University Incubation Center for Startups) and was lucky enough to work with amazing startups in both on their early ideation stages and on their struggle to growth.

I’m truly passionate about my work and always eager to connect with other startup founders. While I enjoy all aspects of company building, I think my favourite stage of a project is working with new designs and smart ways of implement cutting edge technology to new products with the team. As we go through that collaborative process, ideas start to flow and that’s always the fun part.

I’m always interested in hearing from former colleagues, startup founders, or just interesting creative folk, so feel free to contact me if you’d like to connect.

name: Hayley Leibson
title: Product Leader | Prev. Exited Founder | Forbes 30 Under 30, Harvard, Y Combinator alum
about:
Hayley is a product leader, exited tech founder, and bestselling author with over a decade of experience building products loved by millions of people around the world. Hayley is a Forbes 30 Under 30 for consumer technology and board member, Harvard University graduate student, and Y Combinator alumni.

Hayley is the author of the new international bestseller "Raise Early Stage Venture Capital: The First Guide to Startup Fundraising for Women and Minority Founders" published by Jetpack Books. She founded three multiple-million dollar technology companies, raised over $50+ million, and sold two companies before the age of 30.

Hayley and her work have been featured in media outlets including The New York Times, ABC, BBC World Service, The Wall Street Journal, Harper's Bazaar, The Washington Post, TechCrunch, Business Insider, Entrepreneur, Protocol, Valley Talks, Girlboss Media, a Harvard Business School case study, and more. She was named one of "15 Entrepreneurs Under 30 to Watch Out For" by Entrepreneur, a "Woman of Influence" by Silicon Valley Business Journal, a "Top Founder Investing In Other Founders" by Business Insider, a Women in IT Awards Silicon Valley "Rising Star of the Year" in 2019, a "Top Tech Influencer" by IVY Magazine, "Most Influential Women in Tech" alongside Sheryl Sandberg and Katrina Lake, and included in "20 On The Rise" in 2018.

Select list of speaking engagements: Stanford University, Harvard University, UC Berkeley Haas, University of Pennsylvania Wharton School, University of Cambridge, Women in Technology Summit, Tech Inclusion, National Association of Women Business Owners Silicon Valley, and more.

Website: http://hayleyleibson.com

name: Francisco Marin
title: Founder & CEO at Cognitive Talent Solutions | Founding Member of the Network-First Manifesto
about:
Francisco Marin is the Founder and CEO of Cognitive Talent Solutions (CTS) and a Founding Member of the Network-First Manifesto, a global initiative advocating for a shift from rigid hierarchies to network-based models of work. Based in Palo Alto, Francisco leads CTS, a company at the forefront of AI-powered Organizational Network Analysis (ONA). Under his leadership, CTS has supported Fortune 500 companies such as Thermo Fisher Scientific, Coca-Cola, and CBRE in enhancing talent strategies, optimizing organizational structures, and improving collaboration dynamics. Recognized by RedThread Research and Everest Group as a leading People Analytics vendor, CTS was named the Best Innovative Solution in Talent Analytics at the 2025 HR Tech Awards.

With over a decade of experience in AI and People Analytics, Francisco has been instrumental in advancing network science in corporate settings. He co-developed the first generation of AI agents for People Analytics, including eight patent-pending AI agents covering use cases like onboarding, change management, and organizational development. He has also led strategic partnerships with ServiceNow and Google, making CTS the only ONA provider with direct integration routes into mainstream enterprise ecosystems. Through the Network-First Manifesto, Francisco unites leaders and organizations to shape a future of work built on collaborative freedom, trust, and social capital.

Before founding CTS, Francisco worked as a Business Analytics Leader at IBM, deploying AI-powered solutions for process automation and predictive talent retention on a global scale. He holds a Master’s Degree in Business Administration from Loyola University and is a certified Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, with expertise in Agile, Lean, Six Sigma, and Design Thinking methodologies.

Francisco is also the Co-Founder of the People Analytics Society (PAS) under DCH, an international association of HR executives with more than 4,000 members across 12 countries, where he serves as an Ambassador in the US. He is a frequent speaker at industry conferences and academic institutions, contributing thought leadership on ONA, AI agents, and social capital strategies. Fluent in English, Spanish, Slovak, and Japanese, he has worked across North America, Asia, and Europe to help organizations become more agile, meritocratic, and resilient.

name: Giordano Botta PhD
title: CEO & Co-Founder at Allelica
about:
I’m focused on advancing precision medicine for common diseases and ensuring that no high-risk individuals go undetected in physicians' offices.

At Allelica, we develop clinical Multi-Ancestry Polygenic Risk Score (PRS) tests to prevent cardiovascular disease, cancer and neurodegenerative disease and we combine them with traditional genetic testing and clinical risk models to enable the next generation of clinical genomics.

Our diagnostics are used by leading healthcare institutions in the US and internationally to identify individuals who benefit from personalized therapeutic interventions and screening strategies.

We also enable clinical genetics labs to develop and deliver their own PRS-based diagnostics through a decentralized model. With partners like Baylor College of Medicine, we’ve set the industry standard for building clinical PRS tests with scientific rigor, regulatory compliance, and clinical utility.

Our infrastructure supports cloud-based and on-premise deployment, helping labs and biopharma companies run validated, multi-ancestry PRS analyses at scale.

Our work has been published in Circulation, Nature Communications, and the Journal of the American Heart Association, and presented at major global conferences.

We believe that data-driven risk stratification is the future of primary prevention, and that medicine should work better for everyone. By empowering the transition from sick care to true healthcare, we’re helping shift the focus to prevention, and payers are recognizing the value, as our approach not only improves health outcomes but is also cost-effective.

Above all, I believe in the power of a team with diverse life stories and expertise, all moving and dreaming in the same direction, to change the world for the better.
speaking_engagements: Speaker at PMWC Precision Medicine World Conference on Multi-Ancestry Polygenic Risk Score for Heart Attack Prevention; Featured guest on DNA Today podcast discussing polygenic risk scores; Interviewed about Allelica's genomics innovations and AI-driven personalized nutrition; Participated in Valor Ventures video on Genomic SaaS and collaboration with pharma
notable_achievements: Pioneered multi-ancestry polygenic risk scores (PRS); Developed the first clinical PRS test for Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) used by leading healthcare systems; Led creation of software engine integrating genomic and clinical data from over one million individuals; Holds five patents related to polygenic risk scores

I’m an educator, strategist, and founder working at the intersection of AI, ethics, and learning design. I lead with the belief that education should be both future-facing and deeply human, a space where critical engagement and thoughtful innovation go hand in hand.

As the founder and CEO of AI Edify, I design frameworks, tools, and learning experiences that help schools navigate the ethical and educational implications of AI. From staff development and AI readiness audits to student-led design challenges, my work invites communities to approach emerging technologies with care, creativity, and courage.

I currently work as a History teacher and digital leader in the UK independent sector, and I’m pursuing a Master’s at the University of Oxford, where my research explores the transformative potential of generative AI in education. My focus is on how we can use this technology not just to automate, but to amplify, fostering inclusivity, imagination, and critical consciousness in the classroom.

Please note: The views and opinions I share on this platform are solely my own and do not necessarily reflect those of my current or previous employers.

about:
Entrepreneur, innovator, and proven executive leader. Passionate about enabling high performing teams, solving big problems, and delivering joy to customers. 

In early March 2020, Governor Jared Polis sought to bring innovation and a startup mentality to the rapidly evolving threat of the novel coronavirus and tapped me to lead the effort. Together with my exceptional team, I navigated data paucity, an exceedingly complex political environment, and the limitations of government procurement to expand COVID testing from 50 to 50,000 per day in 4 months, build a service corp-based contact tracing program that saved taxpayers $30M, and procure innovative technology that will drive health in Colorado for decades. I couldn't be prouder of the work we did in service to the people of my home state (the best state!). 

2018 Entrepreneur of the Year, Downtown Denver Partnership; 2018 US Representative, Global Entrepreneur Summit; 2019 Denver Business Journal’s 40 under 40; 2020 Cartier Women’s Initiative Fellow; 2x TedxMileHigh presenter; 2020 Inc. Magazines Female Founders 100.

title: Creating your Digital Twin | CEO at Native AI
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Currently, I am part of the incredible team at Native AI— we’re pioneering a smarter, faster, and more scalable way to understand humans. 

Our platform creates AI-powered Digital Twins—privacy-safe versions of real customers —trained on first-party data, public sources, and behavioral patterns. These digital twins allow brands to instantly simulate customer feedback, test products and messaging, and predict market outcomes—without waiting weeks for surveys or focus groups.

We work with Fortune 500 companies across CPG, retail, healthcare, and financial services to power product innovation, segmentation, trend detection, and competitive intelligence. Our mission is to replace traditional research bottlenecks with a real-time, always-on system for understanding consumer behavior.

Backed by top-tier investors and recognized by Gartner as a leading innovator in synthetic data and digital twins.

As the co-founder and CEO of Orby.co, I lead a new generation of neurotechnologists building the future of human-machine symbiosis. I'm a biomedical engineer and neuroscientist with two master’s degrees — one in neuroengineering and another in business strategy — that form the foundation for a career dedicated to integrating biological intelligence and artificial systems.

name: Bryan Levenson

about:
Bryan Levenson is the Founder and CEO of CYTK.com, an AI-powered search platform transforming how automotive technicians access repair knowledge—hands-free, in real time, and right at the vehicle.

A thoughtful entrepreneur at the intersection of AI, human connection, and industrial empowerment.

Before founding CYTK, Bryan co-created Echo, a pioneering cloud-native ML/NLU platform for social data analytics, working with companies such as Twitter subsidiary GNIP. At QiO Technologies, he collaborated with Rolls-Royce turbine product teams to architect one of their first ML-powered analytics systems for turbine engine production.

He has contributed to several high-profile exits:

- Intershop (IPO – Frankfurt Stock Exchange)
- IGN.com (acquired by Fox for $650M)
- EyeGroove (acquired by Facebook)

But his proudest work lives in the next generation of ethical, emotionally intelligent AI.
He is the creator of Q, CYTK’s intelligent agent for technicians—voice-first, respectful, and designed to support skilled trades with dignity and speed. 

He also co-developed Blinkr, a playful and inclusive communication platform inspired by middle school note-passing—technology that sparks joy, not addiction.

Through these projects—Bryan champions a future where AI grows not apart from us, but with us.

name: James Tanton
title: Math Educator | Curriculum Developer | Author & Online Course Creator | International Consultant
about:
I am an educator rethinking the college and high school math curriculum to create a more effective and joyous educational experience for all. With a Ph.D. in mathematics from Princeton University, and over 20 years of teaching experience--college and high school--I recently served as the Mathematics Course Architect for an AI-driven tutoring company, but I have primarily worked as an independent education consultant for the past decade. Each year, I consult with schools and colleges globally, accepting an average of 15 national and 15 international invitations per year to help educators transform their approaches to teaching mathematics.

From 2004 to 2011, I designed and conducted core mathematics courses for Northeastern University’s Master’s degree in Mathematics Education and delivered courses for the Harvard Extension School and Math for America’s Washington DC branch. My work has directly engaged over 5,000 mathematics educators, and my curriculum work has reached over 7 million students.

As an author of 16 books on mathematics, I create educational content for The Teaching Company’s GREAT COURSES series and maintain a strong outreach presence on social media. My YouTube videos have garnered over 3.6 million views, and I have shared an original mathematics problem daily on 𝕏 (Twitter) since 2009, amassing 33.6K followers.

In 2016, I co-founded the Global Math Project (GMP) to transform the perception and teaching of mathematics worldwide through my visual approach, Exploding Dots. This initiative has engaged 7.8 million participants from over 150 countries and territories. The impact of Exploding Dots is currently being studied, with ongoing research in schools in Barcelona.

My latest project involves compiling a new program for Developmental Mathematics and College Algebra courses based on the principles of Exploding Dots, with a focus on kindness and human relevance in teaching. I believe that mathematics can be a gateway to meaning, value, and joy for students, and I strive to present concepts in a way that is engaging and accessible. I have also self-published over a dozen curriculum books that reflect this philosophy, with over 10,500 volumes sold.

I am passionate about changing the narrative around mathematics education to make it more inviting and reduce the fear that often surrounds the subject, ultimately encouraging more students to pursue STEM fields.
speaking_engagements: Founder and former CEO of Beagle Learning, an edtech startup focused on building agency, self-efficacy, and critical thinking skills
notable_achievements: Winner of the Kidder Faculty Prize; Author of over ten books on mathematics and education; Creator of popular mathematics videos on YouTube with over 2,100,000 views as of 2024; Visiting scholar at the Mathematical Association of America
reasoning: James Tanton demonstrates extensive technical expertise and thought leadership in mathematics education, fitting the L3 'Technical and Management Veterans' profile. name: Jerry Beinhauer MD
title: Apaly - Advanced Primary Care Plus (APC+) for Employees and their Families
about:
I often joke that I am part physician – part techie nerd.  As far back as I can remember, I have always had a love for healthcare and technology.  Throughout my life, these interests have often carried me down several distinct, frequently separate, but sometimes briefly intersecting career paths.  Prior to medical school, I worked in network engineering. During medical school, because of my technology background, I served as a technology consultant for healthcare providers (medical students will do pretty much anything for money or FOOD).  After residency, I started a hospitalist practice. However, I had always felt the strong desire to merge my passions together into a single parallel trajectory.

My inspiration to launch Apaly Health was triggered by my profound belief that as the U.S. healthcare system developed into the massive industry that it is today, a core concept was frequently being overlooked: PEOPLE.  The fundamental and most important event that drives everything in our entire healthcare system, is the physician – patient interaction. Without this interaction between PEOPLE, nothing else matters.

This is why at Apaly Health, we believe that healthcare should revolve around this interaction between the patient and physician, and that all other components in our healthcare system should exist to seamlessly support this process, while creating an epic experience, improving health and wellness, and lowering overall costs.
speaking_engagements: Speaker profile on Sessionize highlighting experience in healthcare and technology sectors

about:
Charles, a Silicon Valley and venture-backed serial entrepreneur, founded Vectron Graphics, one of the world’s first CAD computing companies, and as a Microsoft alum was a Co-founder of Gift Certificates.com, successfully sold to AOL, a leader in online services. He has sold Commercial CAD Technology to the Stanford Linear Accelerator (SLAC), Harris Corp (now L3 Harris Technologies, defense contractor), NASA Ames Laboratory, and McDonnell Douglas (now Boeing). Also, he is noted for two AI systems and three generations of CAD.

His broad management, startup, and combined development experience in neurological test equipment, CPUs, and artificial intelligence software makes him a uniquely qualified expert. He has a Master of Science in Computer Science and a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, attended the Stanford University Business School AEA, along with, membership in several High-IQ Societies and the Forbes Technology Council.

He is the author of numerous published science books, articles, papers, and technical presentations. He received a 5-Star and a Notable Book Award for “Will Computers Revolt” and received a Microsoft Fellow Award Nomination. Also, he has been written about in Newsweek and other leading media.

As an extreme sailor, in 2017 he was the Captain of one of only 15 sailboats in the world (as recorded by the University of Cambridge, UK, Scott Polar Research Institute), to Circumnavigate the North American Continent via the Arctic Northwest Passage Transit. Satellite-mapping was used to survey the route and a new channel was added in the Arctic Tasmania Islands, now named after Charles. He is also one of the few to additionally complete a sailing World Circumnavigation.

name: Ahmad Malkawi
title: CEO of Global Telecom, an Internet of Things company
about:
Ahmad Malkawi has 20 years of experience in the wireless and telecommunications industry, working for some of the largest names in the business, including AT&T, Motorola, T-Mobile/Sprint and Qualcomm.

In 2018, he founded Global Telecom, an Irvine-based company that engineers hardware, software and AI solutions that enable a reliable and secure Internet of Things (IoT). The company is the only American module maker in the global IoT marketplace. 

Malkawi holds two patents for wireless technology from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and is frequently featured in the news media. He's written commentary for IoT Evolution and 5GRadar.

Project Expertise:
 - Development, evaluation, design, optimization, and management of major U.S. and international CDMA 3G1X, UMTS, WIMAX and LTE networks.
 - Development of state-of-the-art software components (InterMod60, IMOptimizer, Genesis and HOM).
 - Designed the technical aspects of new PCS, WIMAX, LTE and 3G1X deployments. 

Skills & Specialization:
 - RF system design and analysis
 - Wireless standards and the impact of emerging technologies
 - Quantum Cryptography
 - Spectrum Efficiency
 - MIMO
 - Software and computer architect’s reliability, availability, mobility, performance and scalability (RAMPS)
 - Product Development
 - OEM Negotiation
 - Algorithm Structure 
 - Detailed Technical Analysis

Awards and Recognition:
-The Leading Lights Awards named Global Telecom (in partnership with Ooma) a finalist in the "Most Innovative 4G/5G Business Service" category (2021)
-The NetStick Ethernet Cradle was named to CRN's "Ten Hottest IoT Devices of 2020"
-The company earned the "M2M Equipment Provider of the Year" award at the 4th Annual Mobile Breakthrough Awards (2020)
-Global Telecom was recognized at the 8th Annual Compass Intelligence Tech Awards as the “Emerging IoT Company of the Year” (2020)

name: Eli Gurfel
title: Global Telecom CEO | Serial Founder | Angel Investor
about:
I’m a serial entrepreneur with over 30 years of experience in global telecommunications.

As CEO of Marco Polo Communications Group, a wholesale Communications Service Provider focused on directing call routing to emerging markets, I have built strategic partnerships, fueled growth, and expanded market presence for providers across SouthEast Asia, the Middle East, Africa, and North Asia.

My expertise is in driving revenue growth by forming strategic alliances with technology providers, local operators, and content creators to offer a wider range of services, from bundled offerings to exclusive content, which can attract and retain customers.

I thrive on developing value-added services and creating new revenue streams by introducing differentiated products and services that leverage the latest telecom technologies.

I’m known for engaging in creative deal-making that creates win-win scenarios, such as flexible pricing models, shared ventures in new markets, and collaborative development of specialized services for niche industries.

Noteworthy Achievements:

• 14+ years as a top supplier to SkypeOut in SouthEast Asia, providing international terminations to Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Myanmar, India, and Malaysia

• Facilitating inter-Asia voice trading by building bilateral relationships with China Mobile International and numerous regional Mobile Network Operators 

• Building bilateral relationships with CMI, Telin, Citic, HKBN and numerous Mobile Network Operators across South East Asia

I’m passionate about helping people to connect because of my diverse cultural background, extensive travels, and beautiful experiences living on 4 continents. These factors have shaped my life and expanded my ability to connect with new people and adapt to new environments.

I’m also an angel investor with active investments in telecom, environmental, and medical tourism businesses. I’m happy to connect and engage with telecom executives and startup executives.

name: Sharena Rice
title: Research Scientist at Sanmai. Medical devices. Neurotechnology. Contributing Editor at Neurotech Reports.
about:
⚙️ My life goal is to take as much suffering as possible and invert it. I do this by expanding what humans, machines, and narratives do together.

Follow me for the neurotech. Stay for the dimensions of the story.

———
Longer version:
👓 I run visual simulations and thought experiments in my imagination: a natural gift that allows me to bring solutions into the real world.

In childhood, I had many ideas! My dream was to be a scientist and write books about my inventions.
This is how I had fun:
🔋 Tinkered with electronics 
🐶  Trained my dog
🤝 Volunteered
📚 Read voraciously
✍️ Wrote a 45-page (typed, single spaced) documentary on my observations of human behavior
🎶🎷 Played music on 4 woodwind instruments
💰🔬 Invested gift card money in science kits

Fast-forward to the present. I have even more ideas.
I am:
🎤🧠 Writing and speaking about neurotech (see Publications section for some of my content)
🤝 Connecting people
🕹👩🏻‍🔧 A scientist focused on solutions as close to the roots of problems as we can go
📝 Writing about neurotechnology for corporate audiences
⚠️ Mitigating risks
🌐 Staying in conversations with many kinds of people 
🌄 Updating my skills and knowledge (see the Certifications section for the tip of the iceberg)
👩🏻‍🔬 Synthesizing solutions for situational understanding
💭 Playing well with words
💡 Always on an adventure: see "Activity" > "Posts" for recent adventures

Notable: 
🤣 Served as UMich Neuroscience Graduate Program's Joke Awards Comedian at the annual retreat for 3 years
☸️  Lived in a Buddhist temple for 22 months, trained as Dharma Worker
📑 I write about experiences and things I notice. Making posts, reacting, or sharing about people or companies is not necessarily an endorsement, it is about transferring information.

My LinkedIn profile is only for reference.  I don't use LI to communicate and don't respond to connection requests. 

I have been fortunate to be at the right place and time to lead 5 VC backed startups all of which had good to great outcomes.  I have been awarded the E&Y Entrepreneur of the Year Award twice.  I and my talented team are on a mission to bring technology to defend against active shootings.  It is unfortunate this is a significant problem to solve, but we must!  Our first product uses AI to "see" weapons and masks with the goal of locking the doors before they can become and active shooter.

name: Akashdeep Randhawa
title: CEO, Symmetric
about:
At Symmetric, I spearhead product innovation and expand our footprint in clinics nationwide, working closely with physical therapists to develop tools that improve treatment outcomes and clinic efficiency.

Today, Symmetric is used in dozens of clinics across the country, including Robert Wood Johnson Health System and leading regional outpatient PT centers.

Over the past few years, I’ve spent countless hours in clinics, observing firsthand the challenges PTs face in delivering effective care. This deep customer discovery has shaped Symmetric into what it is today—a platform that provides real-time muscle activation insights, giving PTs more confidence in patient progress while keeping workflows seamless.

My motivation is personal. Having seen family members struggle with ineffective physical therapy, I’ve made it my mission to bridge the gap between technology and hands-on care, ensuring PTs have the tools they need to make data-driven, confident decisions—without adding extra burden to their workflow.

Excited to connect with others who share a passion for advancing physical therapy through cutting-edge sensor technology.

name: Douglas Hirsh
title: Strategic Business Development, Alternative Investments @ Clearwater Analytics
about:
My academic journey brought me from the suburbs of New Jersey into the heart of Colorado, where I received a Bachelor of Business Administration with an emphasis in Finance at the University of Colorado at Boulder. 

During my time as a student, I interned at Cetera investments in Denver, Colorado. There I worked in a team on the development of client-based projects revolving around equity analysis and portfolio construction for retirees. 

I then went on to work for B. Riley Securities, where I was part of a compact and innovative team focusing on small-cap equity research. As a part of the team, I worked on streamlining processes, client outreach on equity-based deals, and delineating proprietary research to a broad base of high net worth clientele. 

On the private side of my life, I am passionate about rock climbing, mountain biking, skateboarding, and snowboarding, and have a passion for the capital markets.

At Mindscale AI, we are accelerating prior authorization for healthcare providers by automatically generating the required medical documentation.

name: Mohammad Khadra
title: 🌟 CTO & Co-Founder @ Tachyhealth | AI Infrastructure | End User Computing Consultant 🌟
about:
🔍 About Me:
 I am a seasoned professional specializing in spearheading digital transformations, particularly within the AI infrastructure and data-centric sectors. My career is marked by a deep commitment to leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive growth, enhance efficiency, and meet the evolving demands of the digital age.

🎯 Mission:
I am committed to elevating operational productivity and surpassing organizational objectives through innovative technology. My goal is to create an impact that resonates beyond immediate project achievements, fostering sustainable growth and long-term value creation.

🌍 Vision:
In a rapidly evolving digital landscape, my vision is to remain at the forefront of technology and business strategy, continually pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the digital healthcare arena. I aim to be a catalyst for change, driving digital excellence and setting new benchmarks in the industry.


💡 Core Strengths:

🌐 Strategic Partnerships & Team Leadership: I excel in building and nurturing strategic alliances, managing multidisciplinary teams, and cultivating a culture of collaboration and innovation. My leadership is defined by empathy, inclusivity, and a relentless focus on achieving collective goals.

🚀 Digital Strategy Execution: Proficient in executing digital strategies that bolster operational efficiency and organizational growth. My approach is holistic, addressing the needs of all stakeholders while keeping an eye on long-term scalability and adaptability.

📊 Data Monetization & Analytics: Adept in transforming data into actionable insights and revenue streams. I utilize advanced analytics, AI, and custom digital solutions to unlock the potential of data, particularly in healthcare logistics.

🤖 AI & NLP Integration: Passionate about AI, NLP, and automation, I focus on integrating these technologies to optimize distribution channels, streamline workflows, and enhance client satisfaction in remote-first environments.

📈 Impact:
Through my career, I have consistently demonstrated the ability to turn challenges into opportunities, leading teams to achieve exceptional results. My focus remains on making a meaningful difference, not just in the businesses I work with but also in the wider community.

Let's connect! 🤝
I am always eager to connect with like-minded professionals, share insights, and explore new collaborations. Feel free to reach out to discuss ideas, opportunities, or even just to say hi!

Through my extensive network and expertise, I provide our portfolio companies with the resources and guidance they need to thrive and scale. I also have a proven aptitude for acquisitions and mergers, facilitating the company's growth through strategic partnerships and collaborations. I believe that the healthcare and deep tech domains hold immense potential for growth and innovation, and I am committed to supporting the entrepreneurs and companies that are driving this progress.

about:
Founder QuantumAI

Mike Lively is a DevOps Tech Lead, QA Architect, IT Evangelist, and Educator who pioneered Great American Insurance Company’s DevOps program and architected the EPA’s first AWS cloud application deployment. A Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT) and PMI ACP Scrum Master, he builds CI/CD pipelines with Git & GitHub, Terraform (AWS/Azure), and custom automation to drive digital transformation. He holds multiple degrees, including a PhD (ABD) in Nuclear Physics, and is pursuing a PhD in Generative AI. An active AI hackathon leader, he has guided eight teams to global victories. Mike serves as Vice President of Professional Development for the Southwest Ohio PMI chapter, teaches AI at Johns Hopkins University, delivers Microsoft courses as a freelance instructor, and runs a 2,000 member cloud meetup. Founder of QuantumAI, he researches the intersection of neural networks and quantum computing.

Building decentralized finance for the digital age, using DeFi and AI!

Details:
Before cmorq, I led the Data Science team at Clarity Money, building a trusted financial advocate for myself and all consumers who feel puzzled when it comes to managing their finances. 

Before Clarity, I was a Senior Research Engineer/Scientist at Google Research where I initiated and led multiple projects in collaboration with product teams such as Ad-Exchange. My contributions included the identification and improvement of inefficiencies through exploratory data analysis and efficient algorithm design using ML in large datasets, as well as building complex A/B testing frameworks for auction systems to measure and illustrate improvements. 

My research work is in the area of computational economics, machine learning, and statistical modeling with applications in social computation, consumer behavior, and experimental design, where I design scalable algorithms for driving products and features based on large data sets. 

I have a Ph.D. in Computer Science (Economics and Computation group) from Harvard University. I have an MBA from Columbia University, a Master's degree in Statistics from Harvard University, and a BS in Electrical Engineering from the Sharif University of Technology.

Casey Schmidt is the CEO of VoxCroft Analytics, a tech start-up that provides AI-enabled analytics and risk advisory services for the U.S. Government and global organizations. With over 20 years of experience in strategic intelligence and advanced analytics, Casey is the visionary behind VoxCroft's "population-centric intelligence", a proprietary blend of hyperlocal data, artificial intelligence, and specialized human wisdom.

Prior to founding VoxCroft, Casey spent 15 years with the U.S. Government, managing analytic programs and delivering intelligence to the President of the United States. Casey also holds an M.A. in National Security Strategy from the U.S. Naval War College, and an M.A. and B.A. in Political Science from Boston College. 

Casey is passionate about leveraging technology and innovation to address complex challenges and enhance security and stability. Casey also has a background in professional soccer and nonprofit work, which reflects Casey's values of teamwork, leadership, and social impact.

about:
Accomplishments:
I am a tenured Product Manager with more than 15 years of diversified experience across multiple industries. Whether my goal was to ensure the quality of medical isotopes that help around 40K patients each day across the world accurately get their cancer diagnoses, increase the productivity of 120 R&D employees through digital transformation of their day-to-day operations, facilitate at-home dental disease diagnoses through my first startup, accelerate the drug discovery timeline through my second startup, or generate more than $30 million annualized savings through optimizing middle mile transportation network at Amazon, I attribute my success to rolling up my sleeves and understanding customer pain points, identifying the real problem, building prototypes and scaling them successfully. I am in for the big impact. Whatever the problem is, I love owning it and turning it into my next challenge.

name: K. J. Ray Liu
title: Founder, Chairman and CTO
about:
K. J. Ray Liu is the founder, former CEO, and now Chairman and CTO of Origin AI that pioneers AI for wireless sensing and indoor tracking. The invention of wireless AI won three prestigious CES Innovation Awards, including CES Best of Innovation in 2021.

Dr. Liu was 2022 IEEE President and CEO, and was the 2019 IEEE Vice President for Technical Activities and a member of IEEE Board of Director as Division IX Director in 2016-2017. He has also served as 2012-2013 President of IEEE Signal Processing Society, where he was Vice President for Publications and Editor-in-Chief of IEEE Signal Processing Magazine.

He was Distinguished University Professor, Distinguished Scholar-Teacher, and Christine Kim Eminent Professor of Information Technology of the University of Maryland, College Park, from where he retired after over three decades of career in education. His research contributions encompass broad aspects of signal processing and communications. He has trained over 70 doctoral/postdoctoral students, of which 10 are now IEEE fellows.
 
Dr. Liu is the recipient the 2021 IEEE Fourier Technical Field Award for Signal Processing, the 2016 IEEE Leon K. Kirchmayer Graduate Teaching Award, IEEE Signal Processing Society 2014 Norbert Wiener Society Award, and IEEE Signal Processing Society 2009 Claude Shannon-Harry Nyquist Technical Achievement Award. Recognized as a Web of Science Highly Cited Researcher, he is a Fellow of IEEE, American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS), and the U.S. National Academy of Inventors.

Story
I am a classically trained violinist from France, holding a Master's degree in Business Psychology. In 2015, I diversified my skill set by venturing into web development. Added Value

–

What makes me happiest is to develop my skills while collaborating with people who are passionate about what they do. That is my strongest motivator, that is what leads me to my most significant contributions and my best work.

name: Sho Rust
title: AI Entrepreneur & Designer | Empowering Newsrooms through Technology
about:
I’m Sho Rust, founder and CEO of PubGen.AI, where I’m working to revitalize local news by equipping journalists with advanced AI solutions. I believe a strong press is vital for thriving communities, and my mission is to help news outlets tell meaningful stories while staying sustainable in a rapidly changing media landscape.

I also lead SHO.AI, now dedicated to delivering brand services and operational frameworks for the same organizations PubGen.AI serves. My background spans design innovation, entrepreneurship, and collaborations with brands like Disney, Nike, and Google. Born in Japan and raised in the U.S., I bring a global perspective to bridging creativity, technology, and human connection.

Outside of work, I’m a competitive Jiu-Jitsu enthusiast, a part-time lecturer, and a proud dad to my son Kai. My family and I live in Cape Girardeau, Missouri, where every day reminds me why honest reporting and accessible information matter.

If you’re passionate about strengthening journalism or exploring how AI can empower the news industry, let’s connect.

name: Owen Phillips, Ph.D.
title: CEO of BrainKey
about:
My mom had a treatable form of dementia that went undiagnosed for years, leading to a worse outcome than it should have. This experience drives us at BrainKey, a company dedicated to transforming how we identify, treat, and manage brain health.

At BrainKey, we’re harnessing the power of AI and advanced clinical technologies to provide personalized brain health insights through brain MRI and biomedical analysis. Our mission is clear: to equip physicians with the tools they need to prevent cognitive decline and create a world where dementia no longer threatens 1 in 3 of us.

This mission is deeply personal to me, but it’s also a global challenge—one we’re determined to solve.

I am an experienced senior executive with success at both top-tier financial institutions and entrepreneurial ventures, within the US and internationally especially in the emerging markets.   I have built companies and risk teams that have gone from startup to hundreds of millions in revenues and positive cash flow. In the commodity space, I was, for many years, a member of the New York Board of Trade which was acquired by the Intercontinental Exchange.

As a volunteer, I have been a consultant to the board of directors of the GEMS Development Foundation. In addition, I was a board member of the New York City chapter of the JNF.  Finally I was a former President Circle member of the Asia Society.
