name: Paul Blase
title: Principal - PwC - Enterprise Strategy & Value - Growth Strategy and Incubation Practice
about:
As a Principal in PwC's Enterprise Strategy & Value practice, Paul is focused on leading Growth Systems Services that helps clients develop growth strategies, deliver new products/services/solutions to market and build capabilities to help them deliver more consistent, continuous growth.  Throughout his career, Paul has worked with senior executive teams to design growth strategies that include launching new ventures, identifying market segments with unmet customer needs, and designing and bringing to market innovative digital solutions.  Paul also helps clients design digital platforms (i.e., analytics, AI, cloud, etc.) and shape executable transformation roadmaps to increase productivity as they scale.  

Formerly Paul was a Principal and the Global & US Consulting Analytics Leader at PwC. Paul has deep project experience helping senior executives design innovative growth and market entry strategies; improve operating profits through creating more productive business and operating models; enhance customer experience; and design and manage multi-year transformation programs to deliver results. Across these areas, Paul focuses on helping companies redesign their business models to benefit from advanced analytics and monetisation of data assets; apply new analytic techniques to create novel solutions to their business problems; and help companies redesign their analytics and data organisations.

Paul has worked across the financial services, insurance, retail, travel, and hi-tech industries in areas such as distribution, marketing, product/pricing, claims, valuations, and information technology. 

Paul's select publications and speaking include - Milken Institute Global Conference, The Aspen Institute, Chicago Council of Global Affairs, Palo Alto Venture Forum, Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, Bloomberg, World Economic Forum, AI World, Forbes, AI Days.  Paul holds a Master of Business Administration degree from MIT's Sloan School of Management. He holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in mathematics and economics from Northwestern University. Additionally, Paul is proficient in Mandarin Chinese.

about:
Chair & CEO | Purpose-Driven Innovator | Culture Builder | EY Entrepreneur of the Year

As Chair and CEO of Somos, I’ve led a bold transformation—from a legacy utility to a dynamic, customer-obsessed innovator at the heart of trusted communication. Our mission is simple but powerful: to connect people, power relationships, and protect what matters most in a digital world.

I’m humbled to be recognized as an EY Entrepreneur of the Year 2020 regional winner, but the true reward has been building a dream team of creative thinkers, resilient leaders, and passionate changemakers. As a leader, I invest deeply in people. I believe potential is everywhere—and it’s my job to unlock it. I lead with high expectations, unshakable trust, and a belief that inclusive, purpose-driven teams outperform every time.

I’m proud to stand at the intersection of transformation and trust—building the future of communications while mentoring the next generation of leaders.

Core Strengths

Let’s connect.

name: Dina Ruslan
title: Обучаем детей Цифровым навыкам и Программированию | CEO & Founder CODIFY
about:
Я изучала Программирование с 16 лет в Колледже и продолжила в Университете! Кстати не имея компьютера и интернета дома! 👩‍💻

И сказать честно…ненавидела весь этот процесс так как все было очень сложным и непонятным! Мы изучали электротехнику, сети и связи и языки программирования C и C++ которые не используются в современном мире и очень тяжелые так как полностью связаны с математикой!

А мне еще в младших классах повесили ярлык ГУМАНИТАРИЙ и в итоге я боялась всего что связано с математикой! А изучение инженерии на тот момент полностью было вокруг математики 👩‍🏫

Я много раз хотела бросить изучение Инженерии и Программирования так как была уверена что у меня не получится! Сейчас конечно я понимаю что любую профессию может освоить любой человек- даже якобы ГУМАНИТАРИЙ (кстати эти ярлыки в школе очень устаревшая система от которой нужно избавиться)

Много лет спустя когда уже работала в ИТ сфере, заметила что все спрашивают один и тот же вопрос: а у меня получиться если я плохо знаю математику? И чаще всего не идут изучать Цифровые навыки и ИТ профессии, хотя это была их мечта и шанс получить хорошую работу!

И тогда в 2020 году родилась идея что мы можем сделать обучение Цифровым навыкам и ИТ профессий доступным и простым! Мы конечно в начале думали что Автоматизируем сами Образовательные центры и таким образом поможем их студентам получить более удобное и доступное образование!!! Так появилась наша первая B2B компания Codify LMS 

Позже пришло понимание что мы сами можем делать обучение Цифровым навыкам и ИТ профессиям более доступным! Даже для гуманитариев как я 😅
Так мы начали обучать детей Цифровым навыкам и Программированию в CODIFY!

Если хотите получить индивидуальную ИТ консультацию для своего ребенка, пишите нам 💁‍♀️

name: Chao Pin Lee
title: Chief Operating Officer at AIBIOS
about:
Chao-Pin is a self-motivated individual with more than thirty years of experience in pharmaceutical industry with 30+ patent applications and publications in peer-reviewed journals. As an experienced leader, Chao- Pin has led organizations with more than 70 employees with a budget of USD 7mm. Chao-Pin is a certified Job-Plus coach and has coached junior colleagues at GSK and DCB for more than 10 years. 
Technically, Chao-Pin is familiar with the discovery and development process of pharmaceutical products. A significant portion of Chao-Pin’s career was engaged in evaluating and developing technologies to support the pharmaceutical industry. For the evaluation of technologies, Chao-Pin served as the chairperson for the Drug Delivery Technologies Steering Team in GSK. This cross-functional and international steering team provided critical support to extend the life-cycle of key GSK products including Augmentin, Coreg, and Paxil, which had annual sales of more than USD 1B each. 
For the development of technologies, Chao-Pin led the effort to adapt technologies developed from other industry and apply them for the pharmaceutical industry. For example, Chao-Pin’s team applied the electro-spinning technology developed in the textile industry into a method to produce nano-size drug particles to enhance the property of pharmaceutical products. In another example, Chao-Pin worked with a company in California to adapt the computer simulation technologies developed by NASA into a tool to simulate the dissolution and absorption of pharmaceutical products in the gastrointestinal track in human. This tool has now become a commercial product used by many pharmaceutical companies to support the development of their pharmaceutical products. 
At the most recent role as the COO for AIBIOS Chao-Pin worked with TAcc+ program of Taiwan to identify diagnostic, medical device, and AIoT related technologies. The object for this effort is to build a total healthcare ecosystem that consist of innovative technologies to provide comprehensive support to patients from early diagnosis, prevention, treatment to monitoring and analysis of disease progression.
experience_2_company: Biotechnology and Pharmaceutical Industries Promotion Office, Ministry of Economic Affairs
speaking_engagements: Chief Operating Officer, AiBIOS mentioned in RESI Philadelphia 2019 Innovation Challenge
notable_achievements: Deputy Executive Director, Institute of Pharmaceutics, Development Center for Biotechnology (2014-present); Project leader for small molecule drug project for inflammatory treatment at AIBIOS
reasoning: Chao-Pin Lee demonstrates strong technical and management experience that aligns with L3 'Technical and Management Veterans' classification. With 30+ years in the pharmaceutical industry, significant technical achievements (30+ patents), and leadership experience managing 70+ employees, they show deep domain expertise and management capability. I founded my first business at 19 - as part of a student project, I created a geoinformation system, Yarmap. Within five years we opened offices in nine cities, with a team of over 100 people. Our partners  numbered over 150 SMB, as well as multinational ones - NASA (USA), Coca-Cola, Tele2, Yandex, Raiffeisen Bank.

In the US I founded the company Sarafan.Tech - the developer of Sarafan.AI artificial intelligence for the recognition of objects in photos and videos in real time. Today, several solutions work on the base of Sarafan.AI - a set of advertising tools for streaming TV and IoT devices, as well as solutions for retail and solar energy. Partners include: Condé Nast, Hearts, Independent Media, Funke Medien Gruppe (Germany), Adria Media (Slovenia). 

A participant in scientific and public projects dedicated to the fight against corruption:
1. Openness and free access to information about the legal activities of local governments in the Russian Federation
2. Digital system of registering, storage and actualization of municipal legal acts
3. Thematic rubricator of municipal legal acts as a means of ensuring availability of information on legislative activities of local bodies 

I always find energy and inspiration in my family, sport, and creativity. Favorite active hobby - snowboarding; meditative hobby - historical miniatures.

name: Julien Smith
title: NY Times Bestselling Author I CEO @Practice I Investor I Helping people achieve their highest potential
about:
I have spent the past 15 years riding waves of technology as they have grown in importance. This ability to read trends, alongside my ability to express ideas clearly, have allowed me to work with some of the most important names in technology. I have created work that has reached over a million people, in several languages, and made millions in the process for those I have worked with.

I am currently building Practice, a world class tool to help tutors, coaches, and other teams of service providers manage their business. Our team is small and awesome, and our customers love us. Expect to hear more about Practice soon.

My previous venture, Breather, was an on-demand flexible office company we built from the ground up starting in 2013. It was been covered by CNN, Fast Company (twice), TechCrunch, The Verge, and a ton of other publications. We raised over $150m from some of the best investors in the world to build it.

As Breather's CEO, I was responsible for hiring world-class talent, raising funds, directing strategy, finding locations, building partnerships and much more.

Prior to this, I was (still am) a New York Times bestselling author of business and marketing books. My co-author and myself were among to the first to write books about social media and how to use it for business purposes, and many of the best practices you see in the field were first put on paper by us first.

The first book, Trust Agents, was written with Chris Brogan, was an instant New York Times and Wall Street Journal bestseller and won awards including Amazon and 800 CEO-READ's best books of the year. We also collaborated on another book, The Impact Equation, published in 2012.

My second book, The Flinch, was edited by Seth Godin has been read by 100,000's of people. It was published through his experimental Domino publishing project, a partnership with Amazon, and has remained one of the top downloaded / highlighted books on Kindle since the day it was published.

name: Sam Porta
title: Founder & CEO, Queues | Atlanta Inno, 25 under 25
about:
As the founder and CEO of Queues, I am passionate about revolutionizing how large-scale venues like stadiums and arenas manage occupancy and crowd dynamics. By leveraging cutting-edge AI and computer vision technologies, our team is dedicated to providing real-time, accurate occupancy tracking solutions that enhance operational efficiency and elevate the guest experience.

My journey began with a relentless curiosity and drive to solve complex problems, which led me to win the GT Inventure Prize in 2020. Embracing entrepreneurship, I made the pivotal decision to leave college in my junior year to focus entirely on bringing Queues to life. Since then, we've successfully raised $1.2 million in capital, a testament to the confidence our investors have in our vision and the transformative potential of our technology.

At Queues, we believe that smarter venues lead to safer, more enjoyable experiences for everyone. I'm excited to connect with professionals, investors, and innovators who share our enthusiasm for technology and its capacity to make a tangible impact on the world.

Feel free to reach out if you'd like to discuss opportunities, collaborations, or share insights on AI, computer vision, and the future of occupancy management.

name: Mark Montgomery

about:
12x founder, including a business consulting firm and a VC firm (decade each). Nearly 3 decades of AI R&D. Voracious reader, I frequently post about AI and economics. Since 2010, I have been the full-time founder, CEO, and Chairman of the Board of KYield, Inc.  I was the originator of the theorem ‘yield management of knowledge’, inventor of the now patented AI system (KOS) that serves as the foundation for KYield, and the inventor of the 'synthetic genius machine' (SGM). 

I was formerly a serial entrepreneur turned business consultant, a CXO in three mid-market companies, and founded an early-stage venture firm. Among many companies I was an early stage booster for include Microsoft, Starbucks, Skype, and Google (not as VC). I have worked with many leading scholars and universities, including as invited panelist in national tech transfer conferences, Stanford venture conferences, ASU entrepreneur association, and Thunderbird School of Global Management where I attended a 12 week international MBA program, received certification as a global business leader and served as business plan judge for multiple years. 

In 2009 we relocated to NM from SV to mature KYield. I was a frequent visitor and invited guest at the Santa Fe Institute from 2009-2016. My articles and chapters have been published in books, journals, newspapers, and magazines.

name: Nikolas Kairinos
title: Creative copywriter who specialises in making complex technological stuff understandable!
about:
I have been part of the core team at Soffos.ai since the company was nothing other than a coffee-shop conversation between the two co-founders about three years ago. I've worked closely with one of those founders, Nikolas Kairinos, for some 15 years, on various AI related and deep-tech projects.

I am responsible for the 'tone of voice' that Soffos uses to output messages, recommendations, answers to questions etc etc. I also produce and / or proof most of our public facing documentation, such as video scripts, business plans, newsletters, blogs, whitepapers and the like. 

In short, in terms of Soffos, Inc. before the public gets to see anything, it's (usually) me who's written it or proofed it, so the buck stops here!

The Soffos platform is an AI driven employee learning and development ecosystem, providing succinct job-related answers anytime anywhere for employees on their own devices.   

Soffos' unique differentiator from other learning platforms is the way that it solves a central corporate training problem - that of knowledge changing so fast that by the time curricula have been manually prepared by humans the knowledge is already outdated. This is simply unscalable. Corporate training is therefore broken.

Soffos' autonomous ingestion of unordered documentation converts the information locked away within thousands of files into 'knowledge nuggets' - then presented as succinct accurate answers, through spoken or typed natural language, to employees wherever they may be in the world, within moments of the resources being uploaded.

There's too much to explain here, so please head over to the website - Soffos.ai for much more about what our platform can achieve for corporations around the world.

name: Victor Fang, Ph.D.
title: CEO @ AnChain.AI 🦄 AI Researcher with 25+ Patents ↗️ Entrepreneur 🏆 Fintech Innovation Lab 🥇RSA Innovation Sandbox 🛡️Ex Google Mandiant 🇺🇸Citizen ❤️Father 📚Author 🏊‍♂️ Swimmer 🎹 Musician 🧑🏻‍💻Vibe Coder
about:
AI Entrepreneur on a mission. Engineer by training. Artist at heart.
Life is too short for mediocrity, so I build AI products of great taste. 

I live in two great tech towns: Silicon Valley☀️ and Austin 🍗! 

⚠️ Not Financial Advice. All Opinions are Mine. 

Victor Fang, P(H|D), is a Silicon Valley serial entrepreneur & hardcore data scientist, specializing AI + Cyber Security:
* 20+ patents and 20+ research papers around AI/ ML/ Big Data. 
* 10+ years of Machine Learning practice and 5 years of enterprise data science leadership experience at top VC backed startup, large Fortune 500 company, etc. 
* "MIT Tech Review 2017" co-author. 
*  Visa Inc, Credit Suisse, Kaiser Permanente and 10 enterprises are enjoying AI data products my team developed. 
When he is not saving the world, Victor plays guitar and piano in a local rock band. 🎹🎸🎼 He’s also a Master Swimmer 🏊‍♀️ 

Innovations around : 
* Web3 Blockchain Security. We detected the 1st Blockchain APT in Aug 2018. 
* Endpoint security (EDR, Exploit Detection): FireEye HX / ExploitGuard, Mandiant HIP, etc.
* Network security (APT malware, Insider threat, behavior-based analytics) and IT reliability. Led the DS/DE team to successfully deploy ML models at several large enterprises (Peta-scale) such as Visa Inc, Kaiser Permanente, Credit Suisse, etc. (Refer to the executives'​ recommendations)
* Deep learning. Leveraged LSTM/ RNN/ CNN etc models in solving several security analytics use cases. 
* Computer Vision & video analytics. Led the team design and prototype the world's first video analytics on Hadoop.  Led a R&D team developed FDA approved medical imaging software. 


自序
方字維多，嶺南人。自幼誦讀詩書, 劍膽琴心。家人寄望匡扶天下，然嬉遊小兒，非管仲樂毅矣，而戀莊生淵明之超然物外。
及至弱冠，遠赴天朝中原學府『中科大』，研習電子工程。乃知宇宙之浩瀚而吾所知如滄海一粟，忝列華夏英才耳。
乃獲學士，又遠赴京師翰林『中科院』。噫噓唏，西洋之術，豈止於奇巧淫技乎？驚嘆西人研習“機器學習”技藝之精湛，余將窮畢生之力而上下求索之。
因而乘桴於海，東渡花旗，攻讀博士。兢兢業業，如履薄冰。才疏學淺，雖而立之年而無奠基文章傳世，然樂在其中。昔人魯班華佗，鬼斧神工懸壺濟世，非經綸偉業，而世人受益良多。是以自勉。

name: Alessandro Sabatelli
title: Co-Founder, Product at Braid Health. Technologist. Artist. Burner. Psychonaut.
about:
Alessandro is the Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer at Braid Health. Braid Health aims to improve people's lives by providing immediate access to expert diagnostics at affordable prices. The company has reinvented the healthcare stack with a privacy-first decentralized architecture that is ushering in the next wave of healthcare just when it's needed the most.

Before joining Braid Health, Alessandro spent a year and a half at Twitter, where his previous company, IXOMOXI, was acquired. At Twitter, he was the Director of AR and VR, leading future product efforts around the camera. With his team of highly talented designers and engineers, they launched Live 360 on Periscope and Twitter, as well as the Live Engagement API for Unity. He worked closely with Brand Strategy to coordinate both launches, resulting in the most tweeted hashtag of CES 2017 and the most interacted broadcast on Twitter.

As the CEO of IXOMOXI, Alessandro designed and built AR and VR applications for all ages. He premiered his work at SXSW and on the dance floors of Burning Man, and in June of 2016, he sold IXOMOXI to Twitter.

At Apple, Alessandro spent over six years on the Human Interface team and three years in Graphics and Imaging. On the HI team, responsible for the design of macOS, iOS, and watchOS, he led interaction design for Siri, animation for iOS7, and worked on the Apple Watch faces. He also designed and worked on applications and OS features, including Compass and Level, Weather, Reminders, YouTube, Time Machine, and Mission Control. In Graphics and Imaging, he worked on Quartz Composer, a motion graphics technology. There he designed and built content for macOS, including Screen Savers, Music Visualizers, and effects for PhotoBooth, iMovie, and iPhoto, as well as prototypes for desktop experiences and what would later become iOS.

Alessandro holds a degree in Computer Science from NYU, where he gained a deep understanding of the technology landscape and developed his passion for using technology to improve people's lives.
speaking_engagements: Interview with Healthcare IT Today about Braid Health and healthcare technology vision
notable_achievements: Co-founded Visla, a company collaborating with major hospitals and industry

name: David Kovar
title: Founder and CEO at URSA Inc. (Techstars '18)
about:
David Kovar is the founder and CEO of URSA, a developer of cyber security solutions that ensure safety, productivity, and continuity within every domain: land, sea, sky, and space.
 
Throughout his career, David has created the software, systems, teams, and organizations that accurately collect and share verifiable, defensible, facts.
 
David and his team develop automated cyber security solutions for agribusiness, medical technology, critical infrastructure, and defense. His work directly addresses cyber crime and informs domestic and international policies and procedures.
 
David led Ernst and Young's U.S. digital forensics and cyber security response program from 2012 to 2015, expanding Ernst and Young's cyber security solutions and incident response procedures.
 
He founded the practice of UAV forensics in 2015 and is a recognized innovator, author, and thought leader in the field.
 
David has a Master's Degree in International Relations from The Fletcher School at Tufts University. He is a Director for the National Association For Search And Rescue, a CUAS analyst for Delaware Emergency Management Agency, and a private sector partner for New Hampshire’s Information and Analysis Center.
 
In all parts of his life, David works to provide fact based solutions that contribute to optimal outcomes for individuals, organizations, and society.

about:
I spent 30 years working and deploying data systems. I developed HP's first 1U servers for cluster computing and large data farms. I developed semiconductors including large-scale FPGAs, precision timing chips, Memory chips, and 50G transceivers.  I built the first terabit 10G Base-T top and end of the rack switches. I have developed 14 AI solutions for private and public customers and oversaw the deployment of 4 of those systems into production. 

This mixture of HW, SW, and system experience gives me a unique perspective on how large-scale technology products are specified, developed, and fielded. I have been able to advise public and private leadership on their technology roadmap and set up processes that allow for the upgrade and maintenance of those systems.   I have built large and small teams and have mentored young engineers with diverse backgrounds. Helping them to see not only the potential of new technologies but also their potential. I am a leader who does not mind getting his hands dirty, specializing in Python coding for data pipelines and AI algorithms. 

My approach to technology is to love the problem and not the approach. There are many ways to solve an issue and being too attached to any one solution can lead to disastrous results. Problems are human-centric, and I am only satisfied when I solve my customers’ problems. My record of 72 products worth $2.2B in revenue is a testament to that approach.

name: Monal Parmar
title: Founder of EVT.ai - Automated Video Editing and Content Curation using A.I.
location: San Diego County, California, United States
about:
Entrepreneur and engineer inventing products to help others reach their potential.

Monal started EVT.ai based on problems he encountered as a first gen. college student in STEM attending UC San Diego for Electrical and Computer Engineering with focuses in signal processing and machine learning.

EVT.ai is a B2B SAAS startup that automatically creates interactive learning content from long form video recordings to make learning accessible and engaging. Our platform is currently used by universities such as UC San Diego & University of Arizona and is endorsed by UCSD’s Disability Office for improving support for diverse and disabled learners. One service we provide is automated notetaking from board writing (equations, diagrams, etc.) to provide ADA mandated note taking accommodations which the majority of universities aren’t compliant with. Beyond creating interactive notes, EVT's patented automated curation systems increase viewership and utility of video recordings by transforming them into a Video PDF, screen reader compatible table of contents, STEM optimized transcripts, and more. 

Monal is an innovator with two patents, takes a user centered design approach towards product development, and is an expert in computer vision. Monal believes that improving support and access to education is the rising tide that lifts all boats to improve a broad array of problems in society.

Vocinity provides AI Sales Infrastructure that helps digital agencies book 40% more appointments without the hours of manual outreach and delayed lead responses. Our platform transforms lead-to-client journeys by engaging prospects within minutes instead of hours, when conversion probability is highest.

We serve growth-focused digital agencies looking to scale client acquisition without expanding headcount. Our clients typically achieve positive ROI within 90 days through increased conversions and reclaimed team bandwidth.

Our Solutions:

Voice AI Appointment Setting: Our conversational AI makes natural-sounding calls, qualifies prospects, handles objections, and books appointments directly to your calendar with automatic CRM integration.

AI-Driven Lead Engine: Multi-channel outreach across email, SMS, and LinkedIn with AI-powered pre-qualification and predictive lead scoring ensures your team focuses only on high-value opportunities.

AI Sales & Conversion Optimization: Intelligent follow-up sequences prevent leads from falling through cracks while real-time closing recommendations during sales calls maximize conversion rates.

AI Client Retention & Growth System: Automated onboarding, check-ins, performance tracking, and optimization suggestions work together to maximize client retention and expansion.

When working together these solutions will finally get you the growth you've been working so hard for in your Digital Marketing Agency.

Why Agencies Choose Vocinity:

Immediate Response: Engage leads within 5 minutes when interest is highest
Complete Automation: Eliminate manual outreach tasks
Consistent Execution: Ensure optimal follow-up without gaps
Performance Transparency: Track every interaction with detailed analytics
Scalable Operations: Grow your client base without proportionally increasing staff

Vocinity enables predictable agency growth without the traditional constraints of manual sales processes.

name: Dado Valentic
title: Color Scientist, Founder & CEO
about:
Dado Valentic is an award-winning colorist and color scientist with an extensive experience of working at the crossroads of art, science & technology. He is best known for his unique approach to the processing of digital images as well as his style of color communication.
He was also a founding member VR ART studio where he was responsible for productions of original VR Artworks by some of the world's leading contemporary artists. 
A tech visionary, Dado Valentic has worked on more than 60 feature films and numerous commercials, as well as on productions of original digital art by: Jeff Koons, Marina Abramovic, Olafur Eliasson, Anish Kapoor. 
His latest work was a development of Colourlab, a creative image and look development software that was used on numerous high-end productions. Dado himself was responsible for creating a color science for the Netflix HDR production of 'Marco Polo -Season II', which was awarded Best TV Picture, ASC 2016. As a colour scientist, he was involved in 'Exodus' by Ridley Scott, in addition to 'Game of Thrones', 'Total Recall', 'Mr Nice', and 'Sherlock Holmes' by Guy Richie. Dado's colorist credits include: 'Absolutely Anything' which is directed by Terry Jones, starring Simon Pegg, 'A Hundred Streets' starring Idris Elba, 'Dough' starring Jonathan Pryce, and 'Blackwood' by Adam Wimpenny. 

Based in LA, Dado continues his exploration of art, science and technology.

name: Mark L. Pederson
title: Technology Entrepreneur
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Passionate technologist working in filmmaking, post production, content creation and related product design and software development for over 20 years. I like building and scaling teams and products and creating strategic partnerships. Interests include narrative, visual technology, content creation software/platforms, startups and emerging tech. I am currently investigating startup opportunities related to visual content creation and technology.

In 2003, I co-founded OFFHOLLYWOOD, a boutique providing emerging technologies to independent filmmakers and production companies.  Encompassing digital cinema camera rentals, post-production and production services, for 16 years, OFFHOLLYWOOD supported countless feature films and television series and supported projects in 10 different countries around the world. In 2013, LightIron, a Panavision Company, acquired the post production arm of OFFHOLLYWOOD followed by the overall acquisition by The Vitec Group (Teradek/CSNY) in 2016.

Specialties: Design and implementation of emerging technologies and workflows, product design and product management for production and post production tools, business development, fundraising and strategic partnerships, professional presenter and instructor, product evangelist.

name: Max (Chong) Li
title: Faculty at Columbia University, Founder & CEO of OORT
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Max Li is the founder & CEO of OORT. He is also an adjunct professor at Columbia University (in the City of New York). Prior to that, he had been working with Qualcomm Research on 4G LTE and 5G systems design.  He is an IEEE Senior member.

Dr. Li is a holder of  200+ International/US patents (granted and pending). He has been actively publishing academic papers in top-ranking journals, including Proceedings of the IEEE, IEEE Transactions on Information Theory, IEEE Communications Magazine, Automatica, etc. He has also served as a reviewer and technical program committee for most prestigious journals and conferences in communications, machine learning, and control societies. Dr. Li is a grant reviewer for the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada. He is the author of the book "Reinforcement Learning for Cyber-physical Systems" (Taylor & Francis CRC press).  

Chong Li has broad research interests including information theory, machine learning, distributed database and computing systems (e.g., blockchain), networked control and communication, PYH/MAC systems design for advanced telecommunication technologies (5G and beyond)  

He is a skier, hiker, ukulele player, and enthusiast of road trip.

Chris Kemp is the Founder, Chairman and CEO of Astra, the fastest company to deploy satellites into Earth orbit, and leading supplier of satellite engines. name: Vishal Singhhal
title: Helping Companies Unlock 30-50% Cost Savings with Generative & Agentic AI | Mentor to Startups at Startup Mahakumbh
about:
Do you dream of AI that works for you, not the other way around?

I'm Vishal, and I'm on a mission to make Generative AI accessible and affordable for businesses of all sizes. Think of me as your AI whisperer, helping you harness the power of this cutting-edge technology without breaking the bank.

Here's the thing: most AI solutions are like fancy sports cars - expensive, complex, and require a team of engineers to operate.  Not exactly ideal for everyday businesses, right?

That's where I come in.  With over 20 years of experience in marketing, sales, and operations, I've seen firsthand the challenges businesses face. That's why I co-founded CellStrat.ai, a company dedicated to developing Generative AI tools that are:

Cost-effective: We believe powerful AI shouldn't come with a hefty price tag. Our solutions are designed to be budget-friendly for startups and enterprises alike.
Easy to Use: No need for an AI degree! Our tools are intuitive and user-friendly, so you can get started quickly.
Problem-Focused: We don't just throw AI at a problem, we take the time to understand your specific needs first.

Here's what you can expect when you work with me:

Lower Cost AI Solutions: I'll help you find the right AI tool for your needs, without overspending.
Latest Ideas & Innovation: Stay ahead of the curve with cutting-edge AI solutions that can revolutionize your business.
Predictable Development Schedules: No more project delays! We work with you to establish realistic timelines and deliver on time, every time. ️

What sets me apart?

Multi-Disciplinary Expertise: I'm not just an AI whiz, I also have a deep understanding of business operations, marketing, and sales. This allows me to see the bigger picture and develop solutions that truly work for you.
Problem-Solving Mindset: I believe understanding the problem is half the battle. I take the time to listen to your challenges and develop custom solutions that address your specific needs.
Resource Optimization: I'm all about getting the most out of what you have. We work to find the most efficient AI solutions for your needs, without wasting resources.

Ready to unlock the potential of Generative AI for your business?  Let's connect!  I'm always happy to chat about your unique needs and see how I can help you achieve your goals.

Who can benefit from working with me?

Tech Startups ‍
Small & Medium Businesses (SMEs)
Healthcare Providers
Financial Institutions
Education Institutions

I look forward to hearing from you!

Today, I continue to advise startups, mentor founders, and drive forward-thinking AI solutions that shape the future of commerce and technology.

about:
For more than 25 years, Gareth Thomas (FFI/ NCF/ RAW/ ITEC) has been coach and advisor to top endurance athletes including World and National champions in Triathlon, Duathlon and Cycling.
He brings elite level coaching & sports science support to age group athletes and their coaches to help everyone reach their true potential. 

Gareth is regarded as a leading authority on blood lactate testing and its application for endurance athletes. He created the TRIO performance labs in Los Angeles and New York to bring sound training and nutrition principles athletes and coaches of all abilities. With a truly global client base, Gareth works with labs all over the world to support his athletes with valid sports science.

He is the author of the book “Triathlon// cutting edge training for athletes of all abilities” and was head coach of the UCLA Triathlon Team for six years.

Gareth is the CEO and creative director of PKRS.AI. 

PKRS.AI is the first software developed (initially) for endurance athletes bridging the gap from automated intelligence to a full artificial intelligence solution. Behind the app there is a powerful machine that delivers data-driven, holistic & continuous coaching, dramatically boosting people’s performance. We also have a human in the loop architecture with highly qualified human coaches, nutritionists, functional specialists and psychologists that guide users on their high-performance journey.

name: Jason Cain
title: Co-Founder & Chief Strategy Officer | ShiftMate – The AI Copilot for Credit Unions | Board Chair | Ex-CTO/CDO/CISO | Turning AI & Open-Banking into Growth Engines
about:
I build real-time intelligence layers that let credit unions and community banks out-maneuver giants.

Today I’m the Co-Founder & Chief Strategy Officer at ShiftMate—an AI platform that sits between core systems, staff, and members, spotting anomalies, revenue moments, and compliance risks in milliseconds, then acting (or coaching people to act) before anyone else even sees the blip.

My lane:
  - Turning heavy regulations (CFPB 1033, SOC 2, NCUA exams) into competitive moats.
  - Orchestrating growth roadmaps—3-year OKRs through 5-year vision—while chairing a founder-led board.
  - Closing high-impact partnerships that multiply valuation, not just headcount.

Track record, quantified:
  - 25%+ operating-expense reduction and double-digit revenue lift across three credit-union CTO/CIO roles.
  - 500% membership goals via CRM & AI programs (Community Choice CU).
  - 60% drop in security incidents after end-to-end cyber revamp (OMNI Community CU).

Led product, data, and cloud teams of up to 20+ while shipping features on a two-week sprint drumbeat.

Credentials that matter in 2025:
  - MIT Sloan – AI for Business Strategy | Cornell – Digital Transformation
  - CISSP | SANS Pen-Test | ScrumMaster
  - Board Chair, Haven of Rest Ministries & Charitable Union

What I’m sharing here ▸ open-banking playbooks, AI/agentic-workflow experiments, and the hard truths of transforming cooperative finance without losing the “people helping people” soul.

Let’s talk if you’re:
  - a CU or community bank wrestling with data silos, rising member expectations, or digital transformation anxiety;
  - an investor or fintech partner who sees regulation as the next platform wave;
  - a builder who wants to join a mission that’s 90% ambition, 10% ego.

name: Mark Batliner
title: Go-to-Market  | Business Development | Distribution | Sales Operations | Start-Up Operator |  AI/ML Sales Enabler
about:
High-performing sales executive with 20+ years of success driving $500M+ in revenue across software and hardware technology sales. I excel in high-growth, fast-paced environments-building and scaling teams, developing go-to-market strategies, and consistently closing deals as a top individual contributor.

Equally effective leading from the front or rolling up my sleeves to win new business, I’ve exceeded targets in both startup and enterprise settings. My experience spans B2B tech sales, SaaS/PaaS/CCaaS, CPG, and global distribution.

I specialize in strategic selling, stakeholder mapping, and crafting personalized outreach that resonates. Leveraging LLM-powered autonomous agents and agentic AI, I automate workflows, accelerate decision-making, and drive measurable results across sales and operations.

Consistently recognized with President’s Club and Excellence Awards, earning top-performer status nearly every year it was available, I’ve delivered results for leading brands in Telecom, Healthcare, Biotech, Consumer Electronics, and Retail. Known for transparent leadership, executional grit, and a relentless drive to win-whether leading teams or carrying the bag. I’m passionate about helping organizations scale, innovate, and outperform the competition

But the most important transformation of my life didn’t happen in a boardroom.

In the middle of a major personal upheaval, I became the full-time parent to three teenagers, one of whom was battling severe mental health challenges. Being deeply involved in her recovery taught me patience, perspective, and what it really means to show up for others.  

That experience made me more emotionally intelligent, less ego-driven, and far more focused on building meaningful relationships, personally and professionally.

Today, I lead with empathy, stay grounded under pressure, and help companies grow by focusing on what matters: people, purpose, and performance.

name: Raj Singh
title: Founder & CEO @ WayLit | 🚀 HR’s Immigration Co-Pilot | Visa Fire Drills → Scalable Global Processes
about:
I didn’t just build an immigration solution—I’ve lived the immigration system from the inside.
F-1 → OPT → H-1B → PERM → Green Card → Citizen (2024)

That journey taught me something every HR leader already knows:
Immigration isn’t just paperwork.
It’s pressure.

Pressure on the employee to keep their life on track.
Pressure on HR to stay composed while managing something they were never trained to do.

At WayLit, we’re your immigration co-pilot—making sure HR doesn’t have to white-knuckle the process.

We power HR teams to:
✅ Stay ahead of immigration timelines
✅ Keep employees calm and informed
✅ Lead with confidence, not case trackers

We're not a traditional law firm with a tech wrapper. 
We're a full-service team designed from the ground up for HR.

And we’ve never lost a customer who’s onboarded with us.

I write about:
What HR really needs (and rarely gets)
Building WayLit from a place of lived experience
Finding product-market fit by listening to pain
What it’s like being an immigrant founder in the U.S.

If you're in HR and tired of juggling legal emails, timelines, and late-night visa questions—let's connect.

name: Martin Jones
title: CEO | Aviation & Travel Tech Leader | Driving Digital Transformation & Passenger Experience in Global Airports | Ex-M&S, Vodafone
about:
I'm transforming global travel through seamless, data-driven experiences that passengers love and businesses profit from. As CEO of CAVU, I'm turning this vision into reality across airports worldwide, serving millions of travellers annually.

My career spans three dynamic industries — retail (M&S), telecoms (Vodafone), and aviation (MAG/CAVU) — and three continents, united by one mission: creating exceptional customer experiences through data intelligence, digital innovation, and commercial excellence.

At Marks & Spencer, I led major regional turnarounds and scaled the brand across India, delivering double-digit growth. At Vodafone, I expanded high-performing sales channels in a fast-growth digital environment, significantly increasing market share. And at MAG, I helped shape the future of travel — making journeys more seamless for passengers and more profitable for the businesses that serve them.

Today, as CEO of CAVU, I lead a high-growth, multi-million pound global business dedicated to transforming the airport experience. Our team delivers connected, personalised, and commercially effective solutions that help airports and airlines unlock substantial revenue growth and enhance passenger satisfaction across multiple continents.

From premium passenger products to scalable digital platforms, CAVU partners with the world's leading travel brands to reimagine airport technology, travel retail transformation, and passenger experience optimization.

My Leadership Capabilities: 
🔹 Strategic Vision & Scalable Commercial Growth 
🔹 P&L Leadership & Capital Investment Strategy inc. M&A 
🔹 Global Market Insight & Cross-Cultural Expertise 
🔹 Digital Transformation & Innovation Leadership 
🔹 People Leadership & Organisational Empowerment 
🔹 Influence, Communication & Stakeholder Engagement 
🔹 Ethics, ESG Stewardship & Corporate Governance

I regularly contribute insights at major aviation conferences and collaborate with industry bodies shaping the future of airport commerce and passenger experiences.

I actively seek conversations with forward-thinking leaders in aviation, travel retail, airport technology, and digital innovation who are passionate about revolutionizing customer journeys. Let's discuss how we can shape the future of global travel together.

name: Somen Saha
title: Director, IT Application Operations, MA DPH | Driving award-winning healthcare tech & AI innovation
about:
Technology executive, product strategist, and AI pioneer driving digital transformation across public health, higher education, and Fortune-100 commerce. Now Director of IT Application Operations at the Massachusetts Department of Public Health (DPH), I unite vision, governance, and hands-on engineering to deliver secure, human-centered solutions at state-wide scale.

Credentials & mindset

• Cornell University Product Management Certificate — translating market insight into road-mapped value. 
• (ISC)² Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) — zero-trust, cloud-first, compliance-driven. 
• PMP | CSM | CSPO — disciplined execution across waterfall and Agile portfolios.

Signature achievements

• Founder & CTO, N-Powered — built higher-ed’s first voice-enabled AI assistant; won Best of Boston Innovation, secured $2 M ARR, scaled to eight universities. 
• Statewide EVV rollout — led Massachusetts’ Electronic Visit Verification program, assuring 21st Century CURES Act compliance and earning the 2024 Medicaid Directors Award. 
• Northeastern University — created an international Salesforce development center, saving $3 M annually and launching a cross-border financial portal for Canadian students. 
• Staples Marketplace — delivered the #1 corporate initiative, tripling online SKU count from 30 K to 90 K while integrating omnichannel analytics that lifted conversions 30 %.

Leadership philosophy

People first — psychological safety sparks creativity; I mentor rising PMs, engineers, and analysts to outgrow me.
Data decide — fuse CRM, clickstream, and operational data into dashboards that sharpen ROI and de-risk bets.
Security by design — weave least-privilege, DevSecOps, and HIPAA/NIST controls into every sprint.
Continuous learning — keynote speaker (Amazon Public Sector Summit, World Lottery Association) and lifelong student of generative AI and civic-tech innovation.

Tech toolbox

AWS • Azure • GCP │ Tableau, GA4, Omniture │ Salesforce │ SQL, Python │ GenAI prompt engineering, TTS │ Secure SDLC, FedRAMP, HITRUST.

Mission & call to action

Technology’s highest purpose is to expand access—to healthcare, education, and opportunity. If you are tackling tough problems at the intersection of cloud, AI, and public good, let’s connect and create the next breakthrough together.

name: Bernard Kress
title: Director, Google AR - SPIE President
about:
What comes first? AR use cases or AR hardware? 

In the early days of Google Glass, we focused on creating stylish hardware without a well-defined understanding of how consumers would use it in their everyday lives. 
Instead, strong enterprise/industry/defense adoption happened and custom niche applications where developed in the field. HoloLens and Magic Leap went through the same awakening a few years later. 
I strongly believe today that for consumers, use case comes first and dictate product PRD (Product Requirement Document) and hardware ERS (Engineering Requirements Sheet) to best deliver generic use cases.

Today, widespread consumer adoption of smart glasses is finally within reach thanks to 3 key factors:

1) A robust AR hardware ecosystem of vendors, contract manufacturers and start-ups, grown organically, specializing in key AR sub-systems (display, imaging, sensing,...)
2) Generic platforms emerging to provide compelling user experiences (Vision OS, Android XR, Meta Horizon,...)
3) All-day use cases powered by Multimodal AI Agentic Assistant as Gemini/Astra are driving demand for always-on consumer smart glasses.

My passion lies at the intersection of display, imaging and sensing technology development and partner/vendor/CM identification and leveraging to build up a strong AR hardware ecosystem on which the industry can rely on.

My dual hat "Corporate and non profit Optics-Photonics community development" allows me to interface and benefit from a worldwide network of vendors, industries, contract manufacturers, start-ups and academic institutions.
education_1_degree: Associate Professor, Micro-photonics - Sensors and display
awards_and_recognitions: SPIE Fellow since 2013; Elected to SPIE Board of Directors (2016-2019); Elected to SPIE presidential chain (Vice President 2021, President-Elect 2022, President 2023)
speaking_engagements: Chair of SPIE AR/VR/MR Symposium; Chair of SPIE Digital Optical Technologies conference; Short course instructor on micro-optics and AR/VR displays; Host of monthly SPIE AR|VR|MR fireside chats; Keynote speaker at AWE USA 2024
notable_achievements: Principal optical architect on Google Glass project; Partner optical architect on Microsoft Hololens team; Over 50 patents granted worldwide; Published numerous books and book chapters on micro-optics; Chair of SPIE Digital Optical Technologies and AR/VR/MR conference series; SPIE Fellow since 2013
reasoning: Bernard Kress demonstrates significant technical leadership and executive experience in AR/VR at major tech companies, particularly Google. His role as Director of Optical Engineering for AR at Google and position as SPIE President shows proven operational expertise and industry leadership. name: Dr. AJ Perez
title: Deeptech Leader & Investor. 3x MIT degrees. Lecturer.
about:
Dr. AJ Perez is a 3x MIT mechanical engineering alumni, a professional industrial founder, and sustainability innovator. AJ graduated with his PhD in Mechanical Engineering and with distinction as the first PhD institute wide to earn the MIT Sloan Sustainability certificate. Dr. Perez was previously selected as an inaugural sustainable design fellow by the MIT Morningside Academy of Design to pursue large scale composites for affordable housing and the recipient of the Chandler Fellowship to pursue innovative recycling research for the health of the planet. AJ was an MIT Presidential fellow, Lemelson-MIT Inventor Fellow, an MIT entrepreneur fellow, awarded the Lincoln Laboratory Beaver Works prize, selected as one of Boston Globe’s 25u25, and won the Lemelson-MIT invention prize.  

Dr. Perez holds a BS 2013 in Mechanical Engineering, Masters of Engineering in Advanced Manufacturing 2014, and a PhD in Mechanical Engineering 2023 from MIT. His academic interests, lectures, and research include advanced manufacturing, composite 3D printing, AI design, automation, robotics, recycling, entrepreneurship, and sustainability. Most recently, Dr. Perez was appointed as the head Research Scientist in MIT’s Office of Innovation to lead USAF and USSF AI-focused research and as a Lecturer in the school of engineering to teach the new interdisciplinary USSOCOM IDEBT (innovate, design, engineer, build, test) course. 

AJ founded and serves as the Managing Partner of Grow Clean Capital. Dr. Perez serves as a sustainability and deep tech advisor to family offices and institutional investors. AJ passed the FINRA Series 65 and SIE exams. In 2018, he founded and served on the Board of Directors of IndustrialML, an enterprise ML & AI SaaS business optimizing efficiency of industrial manufacturers. AJ was previously Founder, Chairman, and CEO, of NVBOTS, an MIT 3D printing spin-off which invented automated 3D printing, cloud 3D printing, and high speed multi-metal 3D printing. NVBOTS spun off and re-branded  its metal 3D printing business unit as Digital Alloys (Series A by Khosla, Series B by G20, Boeing, and Lincoln Electric). NVBOTS was acquired by Cincinnati Incorporated, where AJ served as General Manager. Digital Alloys was acquired by Relativity Space; the technology is used to manufacture rockets. Dr. Perez is the primary inventor in the fields of industrial polymer composite additive manufacturing, metal additive manufacturing, mobile manufacturing, industrial IoT, machine learning, computer vision, medical devices, dynamic structures, and prefabricated construction.

about:
Yousof Naderi is a visionary entrepreneur, educator, skilled technologist, and innovation leader with over two decades of experience in driving the development of advanced wireless telecommunication and charging systems. Yousof is spearheading the intelligent surface revolution, delivering infrastructure wireless charging solutions that are reshaping the industry and improving our daily lives.

With a unique ability to combine cutting-edge technology and commercialization strategies, Yousof thrives at the intersection of AI, sustainability, and the future of work, creating tangible value and transforming industries. He has a proven track record of taking cutting-edge projects from conceptual research to market, establishing himself as a forward-thinking thought leader in the tech industry.

Having earned his Bachelor of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering, a Master of Science in Computer Engineering, and a Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from Boston's Northeastern University, Yousof realized his true calling was to merge his technological prowess with his entrepreneurial spirit. Committed to revolutionizing the way we charge our devices, Yousof aims to make wireless charging as seamless and ubiquitous as Wi-Fi, liberating us from the limitations of cables and low battery anxiety.

Yousof's expertise and ability to build successful teams and partnerships have made him a key figure in the world of entrepreneurship and innovation. His passion for harnessing the transformative power of technology fuels his dedication to creating a better world through his work at DeepCharge.

Always eager to connect with fellow entrepreneurs, industry professionals, and visionaries, Yousof invites you to reach out to him at naderi@deepcharge.io to discuss collaboration opportunities, mentorship, or simply to exchange insights and ideas. Together, let's shape the future of wireless charging and build a truly connected and sustainable world.

name: Mari Joller
title: AI Products @ Amazon Music | 3x Founder | Angel Investor | Advisor
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I build and lead AI-powered businesses that push the boundaries of what voice, audio, and intelligent systems can do for people.

Today, I lead a team of engineers, scientists, and product managers at Amazon Music, working on next-generation AI experiences for millions of listeners.

Before Amazon, I was the founder and CEO of Snackable AI, a pioneering audio intelligence platform designed to unlock insights from spoken content like podcasts, meetings, interviews and more. Snackable was my second AI startup. My first, Scarlet, created a context-aware voice assistant years before generative AI went mainstream. It was acquired in 2016.

I’ve spent my career at the intersection of AI, consumer products and audio helping teams turn emerging technology into human-centered experiences. From launching location-based mobile services for first-time users across emerging markets at Nokia, to building AI-first startups that attracted millions of users and multiple acquisitions, I’ve consistently operated where new tech meets real-world scale.

My focus now: building responsible AI products that reduce information overload, empower creators, and bring more meaning and joy into our daily lives.

I enjoy speaking about applied AI, product strategy, and building resilient teams. I also advise startups and serve on boards where I can support leaders building category-defining businesses.
speaking_engagements: Speaking frequently on AI product design and future of work; Guest on Marketing Futures podcast discussing Responsible AI

name: Brent Totty
title: Human Behavior Architect | Principal Product Manager at Kajabi
about:
As humans, we become what we are regularly exposed to -- that repetition of consumption shapes the way that we view the world.

If we are to reach our potential, individually and collectively -- the things that we repeatedly consume must drive us towards taking action that is in alignment with the world we want to create.

I stand firmly behind simple, incremental, contextually relevant, and personalized actions from trusted sources as the cornerstone of behavior change.

We live in the age of information, ignorance is a choice. Unfortunately, the time to learn and apply those lessons learned is a luxury most can’t afford. Artificial intelligence holds the key to freeing our consciousness while applying those lessons in ways in which we as humans fall short. 

Artificial Intelligence is not meant to replace the human touch, it is meant to be the extension of your human intentions. AI has the power to free us while applying a vast amount of complex information to shape our worlds.

name: Alessandro Sabatelli
title: Co-Founder, Product at Braid Health. Technologist. Artist. Burner. Psychonaut.
about:
Alessandro is the Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer at Braid Health. Braid Health aims to improve people's lives by providing immediate access to expert diagnostics at affordable prices. The company has reinvented the healthcare stack with a privacy-first decentralized architecture that is ushering in the next wave of healthcare just when it's needed the most.

Before joining Braid Health, Alessandro spent a year and a half at Twitter, where his previous company, IXOMOXI, was acquired. At Twitter, he was the Director of AR and VR, leading future product efforts around the camera. With his team of highly talented designers and engineers, they launched Live 360 on Periscope and Twitter, as well as the Live Engagement API for Unity. He worked closely with Brand Strategy to coordinate both launches, resulting in the most tweeted hashtag of CES 2017 and the most interacted broadcast on Twitter.

As the CEO of IXOMOXI, Alessandro designed and built AR and VR applications for all ages. He premiered his work at SXSW and on the dance floors of Burning Man, and in June of 2016, he sold IXOMOXI to Twitter.

At Apple, Alessandro spent over six years on the Human Interface team and three years in Graphics and Imaging. On the HI team, responsible for the design of macOS, iOS, and watchOS, he led interaction design for Siri, animation for iOS7, and worked on the Apple Watch faces. He also designed and worked on applications and OS features, including Compass and Level, Weather, Reminders, YouTube, Time Machine, and Mission Control. In Graphics and Imaging, he worked on Quartz Composer, a motion graphics technology. There he designed and built content for macOS, including Screen Savers, Music Visualizers, and effects for PhotoBooth, iMovie, and iPhoto, as well as prototypes for desktop experiences and what would later become iOS.

Alessandro holds a degree in Computer Science from NYU, where he gained a deep understanding of the technology landscape and developed his passion for using technology to improve people's lives.

about:
MAXIMIZING ENTERPRISE VALUE ✦ STRENGTHENING MANUFACTURING CAPABILTIES ✦ INNOVATING INTEGRATED PROCESSES ✦ BUILDING & LEADING ENGAGED TEAMS ✦ INSTILLING CUSTOMER-FOCUS

Throughout my career, I’ve provided executive leadership resulting in business growth through manufacturing operations and technology optimization. To accomplish this, I’ve spearheaded innovative, world-class integrated systems from concept through development and implementation. The results have led to unprecedented productivity improvements, cost savings, and profitable growth. 

My background encompasses P&L management of pioneering multi-site operations with production technologies and products that differentiate the company from its competitors. My experience ranges from startup facilities to regions across the Americas with as many as 10K employees, multibillion-dollar operating budgets, and up to 25 production, warehouse, and machine & tool building locations. I am relied upon for my Lean Manufacturing and continuous improvement expertise, production technology optimization proficiency, and problem-solving methodologies. 

I am known for promoting a culture focused on high employee engagement and retention, safety, quality, precision, traceability, and on-time delivery serving automotive, aerospace, and industrial customers. I am also a business strategist, champion, and executive leader for complex sustainability initiatives. 

At the heart of my success is an ability to develop and manage relationships, as well as build a culture of diversity and inclusion. A mentor and coach who inspires loyalty and productivity, I am a leader that people want to follow. 

As a leader with accomplishments in business optimization, product portfolio growth, footprint expansion, and M&As and integrations, representative contributions include:

✔ Re-captured customer confidence, raised delivery and quality metrics, and turned around financials improving EBIT margin 25% to best-in-class. Increased manufacturing productivity 10%-20% in multiple roles.

✔ Launched $1B+ of new products. Led steering team in acquiring and launching Schaeffler’s first mechatronic products region-wide with zero quality interruptions, better-than-forecast profitability, and high customer satisfaction.

✔ Reshaped Schaeffler Canada’s culture infusing lean manufacturing throughout organization following FAG Bearings acquisition. 

✔ Defined footprint evaluation process and strategy enabling company to expand US footprint profitably by employing CI processes, digitalization, automation, and supply chain & logistics measures.

name: Brandon Stevens
title: Founder/CEO at Scoutr:  The Future of People Operations, Learning and Development
about:
Scoutr consolidates an organization's HR technology into one unique marketplace. This marketplace is an end-to-end solution that helps organizations and individuals migrate from a job/role-based model to a skills-based model, which focuses on current and future potential of workers.
‍
Scoutr helps job-seekers/candidates learn about the world of work, it helps them improve themselves, and it matches them with jobs/roles.
------------------------

Scoutr delivers the right talent for less:

50-75% Decrease in the cost of hiring a new candidate
75% Reduction in the time spent hiring and getting hired
90% Retention for internal employees and external candidates hired within the Scoutr Marketplace
------------------------

Some of our customer successes:

>>> Spencer Health had multiple engineering roles posted for up to four months - we closed them all in 28 days and have 95% retention 3 years later.

>>> Mako Medical We helped Mako shorted their time to hire from months to days

>>> MassMutual NC uses Scoutr to fill financial planning positions, 50% faster. 


And here’s what they had to say:

“Scoutr has saved us thousands of hours in applicant screening time”
 – Chad Price: Founder (Mako Medical)

“Scoutr has helped us spend less time on screening and qualifying and more time on training and development because the alignment is there. The platform has had a BIG IMPACT on our ASSESSMENT process due to its HIGHER ACCURACY”
– Matt Griffith: Managing Director (MassMutual)


To find out how Scoutr can help you find the right candidates for your openings, reach out and I’ll be happy to walk you through it.

name: Vince Kuraitis
title: Advisor: healthcare strategy, biz models, & partnerships | Platforms, AI, digital health & ecosystems | Career experience across 150+ organizations | Platforming Health and Care!
about:
You probably understand platforms and AI as "technology" -- but do you understand them as integral to your business model and strategy?

I help healthcare & tech companies devise business models & strategies for competitive advantage -- 
with a focus on platform strategy, partnerships, and ecosystems. The "North Star" of platform business models is creating network effects.

Having 35+ years of experience, I've worked with over 150 companies across most healthcare sectors: hospitals, physician groups, medical devices, pharma, health plans, disease management, information technology, home health, and others. 

Clients -- both established organizations and early-stage companies -- have included:  Intel Digital Health Group, Philips Electronics, Office of the National Coordinator (ONC) for Health IT, Amedisys, Alere/RMD, Joslin Diabetes Center, Ascension Health System, Matrix Medical Network, Samsung Electronics, Siemens Medical Solutions, Medtronic, Varian Medical Systems, and many others. 

Areas of deep expertise (at least a dozen projects) include:

* Platform strategy, business models, networks, network effects
* Telehealth, telemedicine, remote patient monitoring (RPM)
* Chronic disease management
* Health information technology (HIT) and HIT interoperability
* Hospital/IDS strategy
* Go-to-market tactics/strategies for early-stage, digital health tech startups

Read more about platforms as strategy:
"Your Company Has A Technology Platform…But Do You Have A Platform Business Model and Strategy?"
https://e-caremanagement.com/do-you-have-a-platform-business-model-and-strategy/

name: Adrian Simpson
title: Co-Founder, Chief Connector, Keynote Speaker, Podcaster, Leadership Specialist, Wavelength Companies Ltd
about:
I'm Co-founder and Chief Connector of Wavelength. We're a UK-based boutique executive education business with a global reach.  Our specialism is ‘bringing the outside world in’ for leaders. We're a grown up, no nonsense, transparent business creating and curating transformative experiences for leaders. We help deliver change.

We believe leaders learn best from leaders and seek to provide clients with world-class external inspiration, education, provocation and application required to drive change. 

Over the last 14 years we've taken thousands of leaders inside the boardrooms and shop floors of some of the world’s most admired organisations in Silicon Valley, China, India and Europe. 

We run a range of leadership programmes that provide the opportunity for leaders from different sectors and industries to learn together and from each other. 

Apple, Alibaba, Southwest Airlines, LEGO, Netflix, Abcam, Four Seasons, Google, Meta, Silicon Valley Bank, Natwest, WWF, Pret a Manger, Virgin Money, Nike, and the Aravind Eye Care System are amongst our clients, hosts and partners.

We operate four services/programmes:

Wavelength Connect equips a cohort of 50 change-makers, from different sectors and industries with the insights, connections and energy to tackle the challenges and opportunities facing the world today. This immersive 9-month leadership development programme hears from senior leaders from world-class organisations to explore The Future of Business.

Wavelength Inspire is your cultural book club. Each month Inspire provides live, curated access to some of the world’s most progressive organisations and accomplished leaders. From iconic disruptors, legendary service providers and innovators like Airbnb, Four Seasons and Alibaba, to CEOs of Unilever, IKEA and political leaders, Wavelength Inspire provides access to global practitioners. No academics or gurus, just real leaders you can relate to. 

Wavelength SpeakersHub provides facilitated access to world-class speakers and practitioners your leaders can question, probe and debate with live. Whether it is a fireside chat for senior leaders with CEOs, or a speaker to provide stimulus for your physical or virtual event.

Wavelength USA takes 20 business leaders inside the boardrooms and shop floors of some of America’s most admired and progressive organisations. It provides access to top executives, curated introductions to the leading VC’s, hottest start-up’s and thought leaders, and immersive experiences.
speaking_engagements: Leadership insights and stories podcast appearances; Leaders Learn from Leaders podcast guest; Featured in People Matters leadership article; Guest on Outside-In podcast discussing leadership and foresight
notable_achievements: Built client base in oil and gas industry by recovering unpaid royalties; Achieved favorable legal results including jury/bench verdicts and appeals

name: Alistair Gosling
title: Founder and CEO -  Building a Social First Media Business - 350 Million Fans and counting!
about:
I have spent 30 years in media and doing a few other bits and pieces. Initially I started a TV distribution company from a barn on a farm, then was struck by the idea for The Extreme Sports Channel. Found some fantastic people to back us with a big chunk of money, then had an incredible time running around the world launching it in 68 countries, reaching 100m subscribers and successfully exiting to Liberty Global the owners of F1.

Today with an incredible team I am building Wavelength a social-first media company operating at the heart of the creator economy. In today’s fragmented media landscape we help brands, agencies and destinations break through the noise by delivering high-impact social campaigns through authentic storytelling and strategic creator partnerships.

We operate a network of brand-led social publishers, YouTube channels and creators that reach over 950 million people per month and have a combined audience of over 350 million followers across Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok. We cater to specific passion points and niche audiences, driving engagement through daily short-form content, premium long-form formats and live events across adventure travel, action sports, beauty, DIY, craft, e-automotive, tech, and envirotainment.

Partnering with social media publishers and leading creators that already have a strong fan base and deep community engagement, we help monetise their reach, supercharge their engagement, increase subscribers, and unlock long-term brand value.

We work with top TV producers, sports rights holders, and distributors to reformat premium long-form content for YouTube and short-form social. We take a social-first formatting approach, reviving iconic programming for Gen Z and Millennial audiences where they watch, scroll, and connect.

We have assembled and united top talent from YouTube, Meta, Spotify, Google, Universal Music, and McCann to create a new kind of media company. We are headquartered in London and are establishing hubs in New York and Los Angeles. So if you’re a brand, creator, social publisher or sports rights holder looking to win in the creator economy—we would love to talk!

I am also a founding advisor and shareholder of Medshr, the award-winning medical network that is helping save lives through peer-to-peer learning. As a passionate skier, sailor, pilot, dive master and environmentalist I am the supporter of several global marine conservation projects. Thank-you | Merci | 谢谢 | Grazie | ध"यवाद | спасибо

name: Kris Verburgh
title: Partner BOLD Longevity Growth Fund, Author, MD | Extending Healthspan and Lifespan for All
about:
Medical doctor, researcher, inventor, investor and author with deep expertise in aging/longevity and new trends, developments and paradigm shifts in medicine and biotechnology - which new technologies will disrupt medicine, health(care) and our lifespan? 

Main medical focus on aging (biogerontology), metabolism (diabetes, cardiovascular disease, neurodegenerative diseases, obesity), preventive medicine, and neuroscience (including brain health/brain aging). 
Main biotechnological focus on novel technologies, such as gene editing, transcriptomics, epigenetics, AI, drug discovery, and many others.

Partner and Head of Science at Bold Longevity Growth (BLG) Fund, which invests in the latest (bio)technologies to slow down aging. 

Verburgh was Partner and Head of Science at Longevity Vision Fund (LVF), a $100 million fund that invested in longevity (bio)technologies to slow down aging. LVF is closed for new investments. The successor of LVF is the Bold Longevity Growth Fund. 

Co-founded NOVOS, the first science-based nutraceutical to address 9 important hallmarks of aging. 

Verburgh wrote his first science book at the age of 16 and 4 books by the age of 28. One 520-page book uses scientific insights from biology, physics, mathematics and chemistry to addresses philosophical questions. His most recent book "The Longevity Code" explains how nutrition and new biotechnologies can slow down aging and improve health. 

“Dr. Verburgh tackles age-old questions and arrives at some startling conclusions – with practical suggestions for how to slow down our biological clock.”

- Professor David Ludwig, Harvard University and Harvard Medical School, about "The Longevity Code"

Expertise and interests: 

• New trends and developments in medicine, biotechnology and healthcare
• Biogerontology, aging and aging-related diseases (including new biotechnologies and drugs to slow aging and treat aging-related diseases; nutrition to slow down aging - created a new field called "nutrigerontology" (Aging Cell, 2014); etc.)
• Preventive, personalized and predictive medicine and longevity medicine
• Neuroscience, including neuroesthetics, origins of creativity and intelligence, neurobiological roots of morality and religion (university master dissertation).

More information on www.krisverburgh.com

name: Lance Legel
title: Former NASA planetary physicist, founder of Ecodash.ai & 3co.ai, principal investigator of NSF-funded DeepEarth AI.
about:
My journey started as a NASA planetary physicist, and progressed toward the study of biological and artificial intelligence, on which I published a Master of Science thesis in 2013. I saw a different future for AI, one where AI only learns to help people understand and improve our physical world for greatest beauty (and today, I would add "sustainability" and "ecological function"). This inspired founding of 3co.ai in 2017 to develop AI for 3D modeling of nature (funded by Royal FloraHolland, Techstars, and Google); Ecodash.ai in 2024 for ecological planting design (now servicing landscape architects in Florida); and a new NSF-funded AI model called DeepEarth (https://github.com/legel/deepearth) for planetary ecological intelligence (e.g. agroecology, environmental conservation & restoration, climate resilience). 

Highlights:
-Developing state-of-the-art self-supervised AI foundation models for physics, biology, geology, ecology
-Founder of Ecodash.ai advancing ecological AI for physical scientists, engineers, and architects (2024-)
-Founder of 3co.ai deep learning the 3D structure of nature (2017-)  
-Google/Cornell 1st place award for machine learning ("Project Clarity") at NYC Data Hackathon (2015)
-Machine learning grad comp sci coursework  at Columbia University (2013-2015)
-Andreessen Horowitz (A16Z) 1st place award for machine learning at Columbia DevFest (2014)
-Master of Science thesis on deep neural networks from University of Colorado (2013)
-MS thesis directed by comp neurosci protégé of 2024 Nobel Physics Laureate, Geoffrey Hinton
-Outstanding Leadership Award with degree in Physics from University of Florida (2010)
-Founder of award-winning technology policy student think tank called TheDynamo.org (2009)
-Bachelor thesis in Physics funded by NSF and NASA focused on planetary evolution modeling

Skills:
-Deep Learning: neural networks, self-supervised embeddings, pre-training and fine-tuning, agents
-Ecological Intelligence: climate change and microclimates, native ecology, ecophysiology
-Physical Simulation: physics modeling, sensor-based statistical modeling, Bayesian inference 
-Geospatial Mapping: GIS, satellites, drones, autonomy, RTK, SLAM 
-Multimodal Learning: cross-attention, rotary positional embedding, LLMs, ViTs, MLA
-Computer Vision: 3D reconstruction, multi-sensor calibration and physical simulation
-Leadership: research & development, sci & engineering, product dev, mentorship, startups
education_2_degree: Master of Science, Engineering and Applied Science
speaking_engagements: Led R&D breakthroughs in 3D computer vision including neural radiance fields (NeRF); Developed deep learning systems for LiDAR and camera data processing; Researching stable diffusion generative AI and fine-tuning large language models
notable_achievements: Founder and CEO of IHS Markit, growing the company from a $100 million dream to a $22 billion reality; Led Lance digital bank to acquire thousands of accounts shortly after launch
reasoning: The founder demonstrates strong technical and academic credentials with over 10 years of combined experience across scientific research, technical development, and entrepreneurship. location: New York, New York, United States

I am a seasoned entrepreneur with 15 years of experience in multiple start-up projects and successful exits. My specialty is in the healthcare diagnostic imaging sector, emphasizing service model businesses, SaaS, and radiology in general. With a consistent track record of identifying industry trends and translating them into operational ventures, I am able to demonstrate expertise in hands-on management and strategic expansion. My interests are in medical imaging, innovative diagnostic treatments, point-of-care methodologies, and the intricacies of mobile and portable healthcare service delivery.

This innovative platform utilized blockchain technology to decentralize the interpretation of diagnostic images, connecting a worldwide network of radiologists with imaging facilities, and thereby elevating the standards of accuracy and efficiency in diagnostic imaging.

Before that, I led a mobile diagnostic imaging company for over a decade, where we extended advanced radiological services to remote and underserved areas. This role underscored my dedication to enhancing accessibility and efficiency in medical diagnostics, significantly impacting patient care across diverse locations.

As the Brand Creative Director at Juniper Networks, I currently lead a talented team in redefining a brand that’s reinventing itself, positioning it to disrupt the networking industry through innovative AI and fabric architecture solutions.

Previously, I co-founded and led LMNO Studios, where I directed high-impact digital marketing campaigns for industry leaders like Samsung, Adobe, Microsoft, and Uber, while also helping tech startups articulate and bring their visions to life. 

While At Google Global Customer Marketing, I built and led a team of 30 creatives and strategists, enhancing customer engagement through compelling storytelling and strategic brand initiatives. I started up the internal agency before it was cool.

In addition to my corporate work, I founded TXTual Healing, an interactive street art initiative that engages communities in dialogues about public and private space, with installations across the globe. My contributions have been featured in leading publications such as Communication Arts, The Economist, Wired, and TIME Magazine.

I’ve had the honor of presenting my work at prestigious design organizations like AIGA, as well as academic institutions such as the University of Pennsylvania and Columbia University.

Core Competencies:

-Leadership and development of high-performing creative teams
-Strategic brand evolution and storytelling
-Enhancing customer experiences through innovative content
-Interactive design and mobile solutions
-Comprehensive marketing strategies across digital and traditional platforms

I am passionate about leveraging creativity to drive brand growth and foster innovation. I look forward to bringing my vision and expertise to a forward-thinking organization.
